faqItems.q: How to calculate ppm blood alcohol online?
faqItems.a: To calculate ppm, use an alcohol calculator: enter gender (male/female), body weight in kilograms, volume of drink consumed in milliliters, drink strength in percentage and time of start of drinking. The calculator will automatically calculate your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) in ppm (‰) using the Widmark formula. For example, for a man of 80 kg who drinks 500 ml of 5% beer, the result will be approximately 0.35‰.

faqItems.q: What is ppm and how to measure it?
faqItems.a: Promille (‰) is a unit of measurement of blood alcohol concentration equal to 1/1000th of a part. 1 ppm means that a liter of blood contains 1 gram of pure alcohol. PPM is measured using a breathalyzer (breath test) or blood test. The online ppm calculator allows you to calculate the approximate BAC level based on the Widmark formula without the use of special equipment.

faqItems.q: How does Widmark's formula for calculating BAC work?
faqItems.a: The Widmark formula calculates blood alcohol concentration (BAC) using the formula: BAC = (A / (r × W)) × 1000, where A is the amount of pure alcohol in grams, r is the distribution coefficient (0.7 for men, 0.6 for women), W is body weight in grams. Pure alcohol is calculated as: volume of drink × strength (%) × 0.789 (density of alcohol). This formula gives an approximate estimate of BAC.

faqItems.q: How many hours does it take for alcohol to be completely eliminated from the body?
faqItems.a: The time for complete elimination of alcohol depends on the BAC level and the rate of elimination, which is approximately 0.15‰ per hour. For example, at a BAC of 0.5‰, alcohol is eliminated in ~3.5 hours, at 1.0‰ in ~7 hours, and at 1.5‰ in ~10 hours. Women eliminate alcohol more slowly due to differences in metabolism. Complete elimination means a reduction in BAC to 0‰.

faqItems.q: Why is the ppm calculation approximate?
faqItems.a: The calculation of ppm is approximate because the concentration of alcohol in the blood is influenced by many factors: the rate of alcohol absorption (depending on food intake, type of drink), individual metabolic characteristics, liver condition, age, taking medications, chronic diseases, the phase of the menstrual cycle in women. Widmark's formula does not take these factors into account and gives an average statistical estimate.

faqItems.q: What is the acceptable ppm level for driving a car?
faqItems.a: The permissible ppm limit for driving varies by country: in most European countries - 0.5‰, in Russia - 0.0‰ (zero tolerance), in the USA - 0.08% (approximately 0.8‰), in some countries - 0.2‰. However, even at acceptable levels, reaction and coordination may be impaired. It is important to remember: if you have been drinking alcohol, it is better not to drive at all.

faqItems.q: What is the difference between ppm and alcohol percentage?
faqItems.a: Permille (‰) and percentage (%) are different units of measurement. Permille is 1/1000 of a fraction, percentage is 1/100 of a fraction. 1 ppm = 0.1%. BAC is measured in ppm (for example, 0.5‰), the strength of drinks is measured in percentage (for example, beer 5%, wine 12%). For driving in the USA the percentage used is: 0.08% BAC = 0.8‰. The alcohol calculator shows the result in ppm, as this is the standard for most countries.

faqItems.q: How does gender affect the calculation of ppm of alcohol?
faqItems.a: Gender influences the calculation of ppm through the alcohol distribution coefficient (r): for men r = 0.7, for women r = 0.6. This means that for the same amount of alcohol, women will have a higher BAC because they have less water in their bodies and metabolize alcohol more slowly. For example, when drinking 250 ml of 12% wine, a 65 kg woman will receive a BAC of ~0.61‰, and a man of the same weight will receive ~0.49‰. The alcohol calculator takes this difference into account.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the time it takes for alcohol to leave the blood?
faqItems.a: Alcohol elimination time is calculated based on an elimination rate of 0.15‰ per hour. Formula: elimination time (hours) = BAC (‰) / 0.15. For example, with a BAC of 0.75‰: time = 0.75 / 0.15 = 5 hours. The ppm calculator automatically calculates the time for complete elimination to 0‰. It is important to consider that the elimination rate can vary from 0.10 to 0.20‰/hour, depending on individual characteristics.

faqItems.q: Does body weight affect ppm levels?
faqItems.a: Yes, body weight has a significant effect on your ppm alcohol level. For the same amount of alcohol, a heavier person will have a lower BAC because the alcohol is distributed over a larger volume of the body. Widmark's formula takes into account weight in the denominator: BAC = (A / (r × W)) × 1000. For example, with 100 ml of vodka 40%: a 60 kg man will receive a BAC of ~0.75‰, a 90 kg man will receive a BAC of ~0.50‰. The alcohol calculator takes body weight into account in its calculations.

faqItems.q: How to convert ppm to grams of pure alcohol?
faqItems.a: To convert ppm to grams of pure alcohol, the inverse Widmark formula is used: A = BAC × r × W / 1000, where A is pure alcohol in grams, BAC is ppm, r is the coefficient (0.7 men, 0.6 women), W is weight in grams. For example, for an 80 kg man with a BAC of 0.5‰: A = 0.5 × 0.7 × 80000 / 1000 = 28 grams of pure alcohol. This is equivalent to approximately 90 ml of vodka 40% or 350 ml of beer 5%.

faqItems.q: What do the different ppm levels mean: 0.5, 1.0, 1.5 ppm?
faqItems.a: Permille levels correspond to different states of intoxication: 0.0-0.3‰ - sober state, 0.3-0.5‰ - slight relaxation (minimal impact), 0.5-1.0‰ - mild intoxication (initial signs), 1.0-2.0‰ - moderate intoxication (noticeable loss of coordination), 2.0-3.0‰ - severe intoxication (serious dysfunction), 3.0-4.0‰ - severe poisoning (hazardous to health), 4.0‰+ - critical condition (life-threatening). The alcohol calculator shows the corresponding status.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate ppm without a calculator manually?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can calculate ppm manually using the Widmark formula: 1) Calculate pure alcohol: volume (ml) × strength (%) × 0.789; 2) Determine the coefficient r (0.7 for men, 0.6 for women); 3) Calculate BAC = (pure alcohol / (r × weight in grams)) × 1000. For example, man 75 kg, 500 ml beer 5%: alcohol = 500 × 0.05 × 0.789 = 19.7 g; BAC = (19.7 / (0.7 × 75000)) × 1000 = 0.38‰. The alcohol calculator does this automatically.

faqItems.q: How does food intake affect the absorption of alcohol and ppm?
faqItems.a: Eating food slows the absorption of alcohol into the bloodstream, resulting in a slower rise in BAC and a lower peak level. On an empty stomach, alcohol is absorbed faster, BAC reaches its maximum faster (after 30-60 minutes), on a full stomach - more slowly (after 1-2 hours). Widmark's formula does not take into account food intake, so the calculation gives an average estimate. For a more accurate result, keep in mind that on a full stomach, BAC may be 20-30% lower.

faqItems.q: What is BAC and how is it different from ppm?
faqItems.a: BAC (Blood Alcohol Concentration) is the concentration of alcohol in the blood, measured in ppm (‰). BAC and ppm are the same thing, just ppm is the Russian unit of measurement for BAC. In English-speaking countries the percentage is sometimes used: 0.08% BAC = 0.8‰. The alcohol calculator shows BAC in ppm (‰), which is the standard in Russia and most European countries. 1 ppm = 0.1% = 1 gram of alcohol per liter of blood.

faqItems.q: What ppm level is considered hazardous to health?
faqItems.a: A BAC level above 2.0-3.0‰ (severe intoxication) is considered hazardous to health: coordination and speech are impaired, nausea, vomiting, and loss of consciousness may occur. Levels above 3.0-4.0‰ (severe poisoning) are dangerous to health: respiratory depression, risk of aspiration of vomit, risk of injury. Levels above 4.0‰ are critically life-threatening: coma, respiratory arrest, and death are possible. The alcohol calculator shows warnings for dangerous BAC levels.

faqItems.q: Does age affect the rate at which alcohol is eliminated from the body?
faqItems.a: Yes, age affects the rate at which alcohol is eliminated. With age, liver function decreases and metabolism slows down, so older people eliminate alcohol more slowly. Young people (under 25 years old) may have a faster metabolism, but this varies from person to person. The Widmark formula does not take age into account and uses an average elimination rate of 0.15‰/hour. In older people, the rate can be 0.10-0.12‰/hour, in young people - up to 0.18-0.20‰/hour.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ppm for several different drinks?
faqItems.a: To calculate the ppm of several drinks, calculate the pure alcohol for each drink separately, then add up. Formula: amount of alcohol = (volume1 × abv1 × 0.789) + (volume2 × abv2 × 0.789) + ... Then use Widmark's formula: BAC = (sum of alcohol / (r × weight)) × 1000. For example, 80 kg man: 500 ml beer 5% (19.7 g) + 100 ml vodka 40% (31.6 g) = 51.3 g alcohol; BAC = (51.3 / (0.7 × 80000)) × 1000 = 0.92‰. The alcohol calculator allows you to enter multiple drinks.

faqItems.q: What is the alcohol distribution coefficient (r) in the Widmark formula?
faqItems.a: The alcohol distribution coefficient (r) in the Widmark formula reflects the ratio of water content in the body. For men, r = 0.7 (70% water in the body), for women, r = 0.6 (60% water). Alcohol is water soluble, so women with less water will have a higher BAC for the same amount of alcohol. This coefficient was empirically determined by the Swedish scientist Erik Widmark. The alcohol calculator uses these standard ratios.

faqItems.q: Can I use an alcohol calculator to determine if I can drive?
faqItems.a: The alcohol calculator can be used as a guide, but NOT to make driving decisions. Calculation is approximate and may differ from actual BAC. Even if the calculator shows an acceptable level (for example, 0.3‰), the response may be slow. The safest thing to do is not to drive at all after drinking alcohol. It is better to use a calculator to plan the time after which it is safe to drive (when the BAC is definitely 0‰).

faqItems.q: How does alcohol elimination differ between men and women?
faqItems.a: In women, alcohol is excreted more slowly due to: lower water content in the body (coefficient 0.6 versus 0.7 in men), lower activity of the alcohol dehydrogenase enzyme, and hormonal factors. With the same amount of alcohol in women: BAC is higher (15-20%), elimination time is longer, the effects of alcohol are greater. For example, with 250 ml of wine 12%: woman 65 kg - BAC 0.61‰, excretion ~4 hours; man 65 kg - BAC 0.49‰, excretion ~3.5 hours. The alcohol calculator takes these differences into account.

faqItems.q: What should I do if my ppm exceeds the legal driving limit?
faqItems.a: If the ppm exceeds the permissible limit (in Russia 0.0‰, in most countries 0.5‰), do not drive under any circumstances. Use a taxi, public transport, or ask a sober driver. Wait until the alcohol is completely removed (to 0‰). Calculate your elimination time: if your BAC is 0.8‰, it will take about 5-6 hours to reach 0‰. Remember: driving while intoxicated is a serious crime that results in loss of license and criminal liability.

faqItems.q: How does the strength of the drink affect the ppm level?
faqItems.a: The strength of the drink directly affects the amount of pure alcohol and the ppm level. The higher the strength, the more alcohol in the same volume. Formula: alcohol = volume × strength × 0.789. For example, 500 ml: beer 5% = 19.7 g of alcohol, wine 12% = 47.3 g, vodka 40% = 157.8 g. With the same volume, 40% vodka will give 8 times more ppm than 5% beer. Man 80 kg: 500 ml beer 5% = 0.35‰, 500 ml wine 12% = 0.85‰, 500 ml vodka 40% = 2.81‰. The alcohol calculator takes into account the strength in the calculations.

faqItems.q: What is the BAC status table?
faqItems.a: The table of conditions by BAC level shows the correspondence between the concentration of alcohol in the blood (ppm) and the physiological state of a person: 0.0-0.3‰ - sober state, 0.3-0.5‰ - slight relaxation, 0.5-1.0‰ - mild intoxication (impaired attention), 1.0-2.0‰ - moderate intoxication (noticeable loss of coordination), 2.0-3.0‰ - severe intoxication (serious violations), 3.0-4.0‰ - severe poisoning (dangerous), 4.0‰+ - critical condition (life-threatening). The alcohol calculator determines the status based on the calculated BAC.

faqItems.q: Does the rate of alcohol consumption affect the ppm level?
faqItems.a: Yes, rate of drinking affects peak BAC levels. When consumed quickly (in a short time), alcohol is absorbed faster, BAC reaches maximum faster and may be higher. With slow consumption (extended over time), alcohol is partially eliminated during consumption, peak BAC is lower, but the period of increased BAC is longer. Widmark's formula calculates maximum BAC assuming immediate absorption. In reality, when taken slowly, peak BAC can be 10-20% lower.

faqItems.q: How long does alcohol stay in the blood after the last drink?
faqItems.a: Alcohol remains in the blood until complete elimination, which occurs at a rate of 0.15‰ per hour. The time depends on the BAC level: at 0.5‰ - ~3.5 hours, at 1.0‰ - ~7 hours, at 1.5‰ - ~10 hours, at 2.0‰ - ~13 hours. Women have a longer elimination time due to their slower metabolism. Alcohol is completely eliminated when the BAC reaches 0‰. A breathalyzer may show traces of alcohol 12-24 hours after consumption, but these are residual traces that do not affect the condition.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to speed up the elimination of alcohol from the body?
faqItems.a: No, you cannot significantly speed up the elimination of alcohol from the body. The excretion rate is constant (0.15‰/hour) and depends on liver metabolism. Coffee, cold showers, physical activity do NOT speed up elimination, they may temporarily perk you up, but they do not reduce BAC. The only thing that helps is time. The body must metabolize alcohol through the liver. Some drugs can affect metabolism, but this is dangerous and not recommended. The best way is to wait the required time.

faqItems.q: How to check the accuracy of an alcohol calculator?
faqItems.a: The accuracy of the alcohol calculator can be verified by comparison with a professional breathalyzer or a blood test at a medical facility. However, remember that the online calculator gives an approximate estimate using the Widmark formula; actual BAC may differ by ±20-30% due to individual factors (absorption rate, food intake, medications, health status). To accurately determine your BAC, use a professional breathalyzer or blood test. The calculator is useful for planning and rough estimates, but does not replace medical analysis.

faqItems.q: What is residual alcohol and how many ppm is considered residual?
faqItems.a: Residual alcohol is the minimal traces of alcohol in the blood after its main elimination. The residual level is usually below 0.1-0.2‰ and does not affect the condition and reaction. In Russia, the permissible limit is 0.0‰, so even residual alcohol is considered a violation. Residual alcohol can be detected by a breathalyzer within 12-24 hours after consumption, especially after large amounts of alcohol. It takes 24-48 hours after the last drink to completely remove residual alcohol.

faqItems.q: Do medications affect the calculation of ppm of alcohol?
faqItems.a: Medicines can affect the metabolism of alcohol and the accuracy of the calculation of ppm: some slow down elimination (some antibiotics, antifungals), others can enhance the effect of alcohol (sedatives, antihistamines). The Widmark formula does not take medications into account, so the calculation may not be accurate. When taking medications, it is better not to drink alcohol at all, as it can be dangerous to health. If you are taking medications, the calculator's results may be less accurate.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ppm for beer of different strengths?
faqItems.a: To calculate the ppm of beer, use the formula: BAC = ((volume × strength × 0.789) / (r × weight)) × 1000. For example, 75 kg man: 500 ml beer 4% = (500 × 0.04 × 0.789) / (0.7 × 75000) × 1000 = 0.30‰; 500 ml beer 5% = 0.38‰; 500 ml beer 7% = 0.53‰; 1 liter of beer 5% = 0.75‰. The strength of the beer is indicated on the label: light beer 3-4%, standard 4-5%, strong beer 6-9%. The alcohol calculator takes into account any strength of the drink.

faqItems.q: How many ppm does a breathalyzer show after one glass of wine?
faqItems.a: After one glass of wine (150-200 ml, 12% strength), the ppm level depends on gender and weight. Approximately: woman 60 kg - 0.52-0.66‰, woman 65 kg - 0.48-0.61‰, man 75 kg - 0.36-0.47‰, man 85 kg - 0.32-0.41‰. This is the level of mild intoxication (0.5-1.0‰). In Russia, this level exceeds the permissible limit of 0.0‰, so you can’t drive. A breathalyzer may show 0.3-0.7‰ depending on individual factors. It takes 3-5 hours for complete removal.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ppm for cocktails and mixed drinks?
faqItems.a: For cocktails and mixed drinks, calculate the average strength or total pure spirit. If you know the strength of the finished cocktail, use it. For example, a 200 ml cocktail with a strength of 15%: use a volume of 200 ml and a strength of 15%. If unknown, calculate the total alcohol of all ingredients: alcohol of the cocktail = sum of (volume of the ingredient × its strength × 0.789), then use the total volume and average strength = (total alcohol / total volume) / 0.789 × 100. An alcohol calculator allows you to enter any strength.

faqItems.q: Can you trust the online alcohol calculator?
faqItems.a: An online alcohol calculator can be used as a guide to roughly estimate BAC, but cannot be completely trusted to make driving decisions. The calculator uses the standard Widmark formula, which gives an approximate estimate with an accuracy of ±20-30%. Actual BAC is influenced by: absorption rate, food intake, medications, health status, individual metabolism. For an accurate determination, use a professional breathalyzer or blood test. The calculator is useful for planning when to remove alcohol.

faqItems.q: How long after drinking alcohol can you start driving?
faqItems.a: The time until safe driving depends on the BAC level and should be sufficient to completely eliminate alcohol to 0‰. At an excretion rate of 0.15‰/hour: BAC 0.5‰ - ~3.5 hours, 1.0‰ - ~7 hours, 1.5‰ - ~10 hours, 2.0‰ - ~13 hours. In Russia the limit is 0.0‰, so it is safest to wait 24 hours after your last use. Never drive immediately after drinking, even if the calculation shows a low BAC. The reaction may be slow even at acceptable levels.

faqItems.q: What is peak BAC and when is it reached?
faqItems.a: Peak BAC is the maximum blood alcohol concentration reached after alcohol has been absorbed. Typically, peak levels are reached 30-90 minutes after use on an empty stomach or 1-2 hours on a full stomach. After reaching the peak, BAC begins to decrease at a rate of 0.15‰/hour. The alcohol calculator shows the maximum BAC, assuming immediate absorption. In reality, with slow consumption, the peak level may be lower and reached later.

faqItems.q: Does the type of alcoholic drink affect absorption rate and ppm?
faqItems.a: The type of drink affects the rate of absorption of alcohol: carbonated drinks (champagne, beer) are absorbed faster due to carbon dioxide, strong drinks in their pure form are absorbed faster, diluted drinks are absorbed slower. Sugary drinks may slow absorption. However, the type of drink does not affect the final peak BAC - only the amount of pure alcohol does. Widmark's formula does not take into account the type of drink, so the calculation gives an average estimate. The main thing is the strength and volume, not the type of drink.

seo.title: Online clothing and shoe size converter - size chart RU, EU, US, UK, JP, CN
seo.description: Convert clothing and shoe sizes online. A convenient calculator for comparing systems RU, EU, US, UK, JP, CN. Men's, women's and children's sizes.

seo.h1: Online clothing and shoe size converter

overview.title: About the size converter
overview.content: Our size converter allows you to quickly and accurately convert clothing and shoe sizes between different international systems. Supports all major categories: clothing, jeans, shoes, bras and accessories.
overview.additionalContent: The size converter uses international size standards to accurately convert between RU (Russia), EU (Europe), US (USA), UK (Great Britain), JP (Japan) and CN (China) systems. Each category (clothing, jeans, shoes) has its own correspondence tables for men's, women's and children's sizes. Conversion occurs instantly when you enter the size.

calculationExamples.title: Size conversion examples
calculationExamples.content: Let's look at practical examples of size conversion for different categories and countries:

example1.title: Example 1: Men's clothing RU → US
example1.description: A man wears size 52 (RU), need to find the US equivalent
example1.input: Category: clothing, Gender: male, Country: RU, Size: 52
example1.calculation: RU 52 = EU 52 = US L (Large) = UK 42 = JP 42 = CN 180
example1.result: Result: US L (Large), EU 52, UK 42, JP 42, CN 180
example1.note: Men's clothing sizes in RU and EU often coincide in numerical value

example2.title: Example 2: Women's shoes EU → US
example2.description: Woman wearing shoe size 38 (EU), need to find US size
example2.input: Category: shoes, Gender: women, Country: EU, Size: 38
example2.calculation: EU 38 = US 7.5 = UK 5 = RU 38 = JP 24 = CN 38
example2.result: Result: US 7.5, UK 5, RU 38, JP 24, CN 38
example2.note: Women's shoes EU 38 corresponds to US 7.5 - this is the standard size

example3.title: Example 3: Men's jeans US → RU
example3.description: A man wears jeans size 32 (US), need to find the size in Russia
example3.input: Category: jeans, Gender: men's, Country: US, Size: 32
example3.calculation: US 32 = RU 42 = EU 42 = UK 32 = JP 32 = CN 175
example3.result: Result: RU 42, EU 42, UK 32, JP 32, CN 175
example3.note: US jeans size is usually 10 units smaller than Russian size

example4.title: Example 4: Children's clothing UK → EU
example4.description: The child wears children's clothing size 8Y (UK), you need to find the size in Europe
example4.input: Category: clothing, Gender: children's, Country: UK, Size: 8Y
example4.result: Result: EU 128-134, US 8, RU 32, JP 12-13, CN 130
example4.note: Children's sizes are often given in ranges to account for height.

example5.title: Example 5: Women's clothing JP → US
example5.description: Woman wears size 11 (JP), need to find US size
example5.input: Category: clothing, Gender: women, Country: JP, Size: 11
example5.calculation: JP 11 = US S (Small) = EU 38 = UK 12 = RU 42 = CN 165
example5.result: Score: US S, EU 38, UK 12, RU 42, CN 165
example5.note: Japanese sizes are often smaller than European and American sizes

example6.title: Example 6: Children's shoes CN → EU
example6.description: The child wears shoes size 30 (CN), you need to find the size in Europe
example6.input: Category: shoes, Gender: children's, Country: CN, Size: 30
example6.calculation: CN 30 = EU 30 = US 12C = UK 11 = RU 30 = JP 19
example6.result: Score: EU 30, US 12C, UK 11, RU 30, JP 19
example6.note: Chinese children's shoe sizes are often the same as European ones

calculation.title: How does the conversion work?

advantages.title: Advantages of our converter
advantages.content: Accurate size charts, instant conversion, support for 4 languages, user-friendly interface, mobile version.

faqItems.q: How to use an online clothing size converter?
faqItems.a: To use the size converter, select a category (clothing, jeans or shoes), indicate gender (men's, women's or children's), select the source country (RU, EU, US, UK, JP or CN) and enter your size. The converter will automatically show equivalent sizes in all available systems. For example, men's clothing size RU 52 corresponds to US L, EU 52, UK 42.

faqItems.q: How to convert Russian shoe size to American size?
faqItems.a: To convert Russian shoe sizes to American ones, use the converter: select the “shoes” category, gender, country “RU” and enter your size. The calculator will show the US equivalent. For example, women's shoes RU 38 = US 7.5, men's shoes RU 42 = US 9. Shoe sizes may vary depending on the manufacturer, so it is recommended to try on shoes before purchasing.

faqItems.q: Clothing size chart: how to convert EU to US?
faqItems.a: To convert clothing sizes from EU to US, use our converter: select the “clothing” category, gender, country “EU” and enter the size. For example, women's clothing EU 38 = US S (Small), EU 40 = US M (Medium), EU 42 = US L (Large), EU 44 = US XL. Men's clothing: EU 50 = US M, EU 52 = US L, EU 54 = US XL. Size charts are based on international standards.

faqItems.q: How does the shoe size converter work between countries?
faqItems.a: The shoe size converter uses standardized correspondence tables between the RU, EU, US, UK, JP and CN systems. The table takes into account differences in measurement systems: EU and JP use centimeter foot lengths, US and UK use inches. Conversion occurs using formulas based on foot length. For example, a foot length of 25 cm corresponds to EU 40, US 9 (men's), UK 8.5.

faqItems.q: Clothing sizes RU EU US UK: what's the difference?
faqItems.a: Clothing sizes vary by country: RU (Russia) is often the same as EU in numerical value, but may differ in detail. US uses letters (XS, S, M, L, XL) and numbers (2, 4, 6, 8...). UK uses numbers (6, 8, 10, 12...). JP and CN are usually 1-2 sizes smaller than European ones. For example, women's clothing: RU 42 = EU 42 = US L = UK 14. The converter takes into account all these differences.

faqItems.q: How to convert US jeans sizes to RU?
faqItems.a: To convert jeans sizes from US to RU, select the “jeans” category, “men’s” or “women’s” gender, “US” country and enter the size. For example, men's jeans US 32 = RU 42, US 34 = RU 44, US 36 = RU 46. Women's jeans US 28 = RU 40, US 30 = RU 42, US 32 = RU 44. Jean sizes usually vary by 10 units between US and RU. The size indicates the waist circumference in inches (US) or centimeters (RU/EU).

faqItems.q: Are children's sizes supported in the converter?
faqItems.a: Yes, the size converter fully supports children's sizes for all categories: clothing, jeans and shoes. Children's sizes take into account age groups and are often given in ranges (eg EU 128-134 for children 8 years old). Children's shoes are converted taking into account the height of the foot, children's clothing - taking into account height and age. Example: children's shoes US 12C = EU 30 = RU 30 = UK 11.

faqItems.q: Shoe size chart: RU, EU, US, UK, JP, CN
faqItems.a: The table of shoe sizes shows the correspondence between systems: RU (Russia) often coincides with EU, US uses separate numbering for men's and women's shoes, UK differs by 0.5-1 size from US. JP uses centimeter foot length, CN is often the same as EU. Examples: Men's shoes EU 42 = US 9 = UK 8.5 = RU 42 = JP 27 = CN 42. Women's shoes EU 38 = US 7.5 = UK 5 = RU 38 = JP 24 = CN 38. The converter provides accurate tables for all systems.

faqItems.q: How to determine the correct clothing size when shopping online?
faqItems.a: To determine the correct size when shopping online: 1) Measure your chest, waist and hips; 2) Use the size converter by selecting the category, gender and country of manufacturer; 3) Check the size chart on the store’s website; 4) Consider the type of fabric (stretch materials may be smaller); 5) Pay attention to reviews about the sizes of a specific brand. Different brands may have different sizes, so the converter provides approximate values.

faqItems.q: What is the difference between men's and women's clothing sizes?
faqItems.a: Men's and women's clothing sizes differ in girth and proportions: men's sizes are usually larger with the same numerical value, men's clothing is designed for a V-shaped silhouette (wide shoulders, narrow waist), women's clothing is designed for smoother curves. For example, men's clothing RU 50 = women's clothing RU 48. In the size tables, the difference is 2-4 sizes. The converter takes these differences into account and provides separate tables for men's and women's sizes.

faqItems.q: How to convert Japanese sizes (JP) to European sizes (EU)?
faqItems.a: To convert Japanese sizes to European sizes, select the country "JP" in the converter and enter the size. Japanese sizes are usually 1-2 sizes smaller than European ones. For example, women's clothing JP 11 = EU 38, JP 13 = EU 40, JP 15 = EU 42. Men's clothing JP 3 = EU 46, JP 4 = EU 48. JP shoes are often indicated by foot length in centimeters: JP 24 cm = EU 38, JP 27 cm = EU 42. Japanese sizes take into account the body type of the Asian population.

faqItems.q: US shoe sizes: how to convert to other systems?
faqItems.a: American shoe sizes (US) are converted according to standard tables: men's shoes US 9 = EU 42 = UK 8.5 = RU 42 = JP 27, women's shoes US 7 = EU 38 = UK 5 = RU 38 = JP 24. US sizes for men and women differ: men's shoes are usually 1.5-2 sizes smaller than women's shoes with the same foot length. US children's shoes have a suffix (C for children's, Y for youth). The converter automatically takes these differences into account when converting.

faqItems.q: How accurate are the size charts in the converter?
faqItems.a: The size charts in the converter are based on international ISO standards and are regularly updated to ensure maximum accuracy. However, accuracy may vary by brand as different manufacturers may use their own sizing charts. The converter gives approximate values, which in most cases correspond to standard sizes. For critical purchases, it is recommended to additionally check the size charts of a specific brand and take into account customer reviews.

faqItems.q: How to convert Chinese sizes (CN) to Russian sizes (RU)?
faqItems.a: To convert Chinese sizes to Russian sizes, select the country “CN” in the converter. Chinese sizes are often close to European sizes, but there may be differences. For example, women's clothing CN 165 = RU 42 = EU 42, CN 170 = RU 44 = EU 44. Men's clothing CN 175 = RU 50 = EU 50, CN 180 = RU 52 = EU 52. CN shoes are often the same as EU: CN 38 = EU 38 = RU 38. Chinese sizes may vary by region (mainland China, Hong Kong, Taiwan).

faqItems.q: Is there a difference between clothing sizes of different brands?
faqItems.a: Yes, there are differences between clothing sizes among different brands, especially among premium and fashion brands, which may have their own sizing systems. For example, Italian brands are often 1 size smaller than European standards, American brands may be larger. Asian brands are usually 1-2 sizes smaller. The size converter uses standardized charts that fit most brands, but it is recommended that you consult your specific brand's sizing charts for accurate selection.

faqItems.q: How to convert UK shoe size to US?
faqItems.a: To convert UK to US shoe sizes, use the converter: select the “shoe” category, gender, country “UK” and enter the size. UK sizes are usually 0.5-1 size smaller than US sizes. For example, men's shoes UK 8 = US 9, UK 9 = US 10, UK 10 = US 11. Women's shoes UK 5 = US 7, UK 6 = US 8, UK 7 = US 9. Children's shoes have the same difference. The converter takes these differences into account and shows exact matches for all systems.

faqItems.q: Jeans sizes: how to choose the correct size according to waist circumference?
faqItems.a: Jeans sizes are determined by waist circumference: in US and UK size indicates waist circumference in inches (for example, US 32 = circumference 32 inches = 81 cm), in EU and RU - in centimeters or clothing sizes. For example, a waist circumference of 81 cm corresponds to US 32, UK 32, EU 42, RU 42. For an accurate choice, measure your waist circumference at the navel level and use the jeans size converter. Consider the fit: tight jeans can be a size larger, loose jeans can be a size smaller.

faqItems.q: Does the converter support bra sizes?
faqItems.a: The size converter mainly supports clothing, jeans and shoes categories. Bra sizes have a complex system (cup and underbust girth) that requires a separate conversion table. Bra sizes vary between countries: for example, UK and US use letter cup designations (A, B, C, D...), EU uses centimeter girth. To convert bra sizes, it is recommended to use specialized converters or tables of a specific brand.

faqItems.q: How to convert clothing sizes for shopping on AliExpress?
faqItems.a: When shopping on AliExpress, use a size converter, taking into account that most products from Chinese sellers use Chinese sizes (CN). Select country "CN" in the converter. Chinese sizes are usually 1-2 sizes smaller than European sizes. For example, if you wear EU 42, choose CN 170 or 175. Also consider: 1) Read reviews about specific product sizes; 2) Measure yourself and compare with the sizes in the description; 3) Choose one size larger if in doubt; 4) Pay attention to the size tables in the product description.

faqItems.q: Shoe sizes for children: how to measure correctly?
faqItems.a: To correctly measure the size of children's shoes: 1) Measure the length of the child's foot from heel to big toe in centimeters; 2) Add 0.5-1 cm for margin; 3) Use the size converter by selecting the “shoes” category and the “children’s” gender. For example, foot length 18 cm = EU 28 = US 10C = UK 9 = RU 28. Children's feet grow quickly, so it is recommended to measure every 3-4 months. Keep in mind that children's shoes from different brands may vary in fit.

faqItems.q: What is the difference between EU clothing sizes and US clothing sizes?
faqItems.a: EU and US clothing sizes differ in their designation system: EU uses a number system (38, 40, 42, 44...), US uses a letter system (XS, S, M, L, XL...) and a number system for women's clothing (2, 4, 6, 8, 10...). Matches: EU 38 = US S or 4-6, EU 40 = US M or 8-10, EU 42 = US L or 12, EU 44 = US XL or 14. Men's clothing: EU 50 = US M, EU 52 = US L, EU 54 = US XL. US sizes are usually 2-4 units smaller than EU numbers.

faqItems.q: How to convert clothing sizes when shopping in foreign online stores?
faqItems.a: For purchases in foreign online stores: 1) Determine the country of the manufacturer or store; 2) Use the size converter by selecting the appropriate country; 3) Check the size chart on the store’s website; 4) Consider the size charts of a specific brand; 5) Read reviews about product sizes; 6) If possible, order two sizes and return the one that doesn't fit. Remember that different brands may have differences even in the same country, so the converter provides approximate values.

faqItems.q: Shoe sizes by foot length: how to convert?
faqItems.a: To convert shoe sizes based on foot length, measure the length of your foot from heel to toe in centimeters. Use standard fits: 25 cm = EU 40 = US 9 (male) / 10 (female) = UK 7.5 (male) / 7 (female), 27 cm = EU 43 = US 10 (male) / 11 (female) = UK 9.5 (male) / 9 (female). The size converter automatically converts sizes based on foot length. Consider the fullness of your feet: narrow feet may require a smaller size, wide feet may require a larger size.

faqItems.q: Jeans sizes of different brands: how do they differ?
faqItems.a: Jeans sizes may vary between brands due to differences in fit, cut and stretch of the fabric. For example, Levi's jeans may be a size larger than Wrangler jeans with the same designation. Asian brands are usually a size smaller. European brands may use a narrower fit. The size converter gives standard matches, but for an accurate choice it is recommended: 1) Try on jeans in a store of a specific brand; 2) Study size tables on the brand’s website; 3) Take into account reviews about sizes; 4) Order two sizes when purchasing online.

faqItems.q: How to convert clothing size from UK to EU?
faqItems.a: To convert clothing sizes from UK to EU, use the converter: select the “clothing” category, gender, country “UK” and enter the size. For example, women's clothing UK 10 = EU 38 = US M, UK 12 = EU 40 = US L, UK 14 = EU 42 = US L-XL. Men's clothing UK 40 = EU 40 = US M, UK 42 = EU 42 = US L, UK 44 = EU 44 = US XL. UK sizes for women are usually 2 units larger than US numbers, but close to EU. The converter shows exact matches for all systems.

faqItems.q: Shoe sizes for running and sports: are they different from regular ones?
faqItems.a: The sizes of sports shoes may differ from regular shoes: sports shoes often require more room for the toes (a margin of 0.5-1 cm is recommended), some brands of sports shoes use their own sizing system. For example, Nike may be 0.5 sizes smaller than Adidas with the same designation. The size converter gives standard matches, but for sports shoes it is recommended: 1) Try on in the evening (when the foot is a little larger); 2) Try on in sports socks; 3) Check the stock in the sock; 4) Consider the size charts of a specific brand.

faqItems.q: Does the size converter work for all types of clothing?
faqItems.a: The size converter supports the main categories: clothing (tops and bottoms, including T-shirts, shirts, dresses, pants), jeans and shoes. Men's, women's and children's sizes are available for each category. Specialized categories (bras, gloves, hats, socks) may have separate size charts and require clarification from the specific manufacturer. The converter uses standardized tables for the main categories, which are suitable for most cases.

faqItems.q: Maternity clothing sizes: how to convert?
faqItems.a: Maternity clothing sizes are usually the same as pre-pregnancy sizes or 1-2 sizes larger. To convert, use your regular size: if you wear an EU 40, choose an EU 40 or 42 for maternity wear. Many brands use the same sizing system as regular clothing, but to accommodate your growing belly. The size converter can be used for a base size and then go up 1-2 sizes for comfort. It is recommended to check the size charts of your specific maternity clothing brand.

faqItems.q: How to convert shoe sizes for children of different ages?
faqItems.a: To convert children's shoe sizes, consider age and foot length. Approximate matches: age 2-3 years (foot 16-17 cm) = EU 26-27 = US 9-10C = UK 8-9, age 4-5 years (foot 18-19 cm) = EU 28-29 = US 11-12C = UK 10-11, age 6-7 years (foot 20-21 cm) = EU 30-31 = US 13-1Y = UK 12-13. Children's feet grow quickly (about 1 size every 3-4 months until age 5, then less frequently). The size converter takes into account age differences in children's shoe sizes.

faqItems.q: Plus size clothing sizes: how are they converted?
faqItems.a: Plus-size clothing sizes have their own conversion features: in the US, plus-size starts with XL and is numbered 14+, 16+, 18+... In EU, plus-size starts with 44+ or 46+. To convert, use a converter, keeping in mind that plus-size sizes may have smaller increments between sizes. For example, US 18 = EU 48-50, US 20 = EU 50-52. Some plus-size brands use their own sizing system. The converter gives basic matches, but it is recommended to check the size charts of a specific brand of plus-size clothing.

faqItems.q: Can I use a size converter for accessories?
faqItems.a: The size converter is designed for the main categories: clothing, jeans and shoes. Accessories (belts, gloves, scarves, hats, socks) may have their own sizing system, which does not always correspond to clothing sizes. For example, belt sizes are indicated by length in centimeters or inches, gloves sizes by palm length, hat sizes by head circumference. For accessories, it is recommended to use specialized size charts or information from a specific manufacturer.

faqItems.q: How often are the size tables in the converter updated?
faqItems.a: The size charts in the converter are updated regularly based on current international ISO standards and changes in country sizing systems. Updates occur as new standards emerge and the correspondence between systems becomes clearer. The converter uses verified data from international sizing organizations. However, please remember that individual brands may have their own sizing systems, so the converter will provide a guideline that will fit most cases.

faqItems.q: Shoe sizes by width: does the converter take into account the fullness of the foot?
faqItems.a: The shoe size converter shows matches based on foot length (shoe length), but does not take into account foot fullness (width). Foot fullness may vary between brands and countries. Some brands (especially American ones) indicate the fullness of the foot with letters (N - narrow, M - medium, W - wide) or numbers. European brands usually use standard thickness. To accurately select your shoe size, it is recommended to take into account not only the length, but also the fullness of the foot, especially if you have narrow or wide feet. Try on shoes or check specific brand size charts.

faqItems.q: How to convert clothing sizes when shopping in Japanese online stores?
faqItems.a: For purchases in Japanese online stores, use the converter with the country selection “JP”. Japanese sizes are usually 1-2 sizes smaller than European and American sizes. For example, if you are wearing an EU 40, choose a JP 13 or 15. Japanese sizing takes into account the body type of the Asian population. Also consider: 1) Read the size tables on the store’s website (girths are often indicated in centimeters); 2) Study reviews about product sizes; 3) When in doubt, choose one size larger; 4) Pay attention to the specific brand's size charts, as Japanese brands may vary.

overview.title: About the ring size converter
overview.content: Our ring size converter will help you determine exactly what size you need when ordering jewelry overseas. Simply enter your ring size or inner diameter and you will receive a conversion table for RU, EU, US, UK, JP and CN systems.
overview.additionalContent: The ring size converter uses international standards to accurately convert between RU (Russia), EU (Europe), US (USA), UK (UK), JP (Japan) and CN (China) systems. You can convert sizes in two ways: by ring size (in numeric or alphabetic format) or by the inner diameter of the ring in millimeters. All sizes are converted based on a single diameter standard to ensure accuracy.

calculationExamples.title: Ring size conversion examples
calculationExamples.content: Let's look at practical examples of converting ring sizes for different systems and measurement methods:

example1.title: Example 1: Conversion by size RU → US
example1.description: Ring size 16 (RU), need to find US equivalent
example1.input: Measurement type: ring size, Country: RU, Value: 16
example1.calculation: RU 16 → injection diameter 16.5 mm → US 6 = EU 52 = UK JP 10 = CN
example1.result: Result: US 6, EU 52, UK J, JP 10, CN 16
example1.note: Russian size 16 corresponds to US size 6

example2.title: Example 2: Conversion by diameter → EU
example2.description: Ring inner diameter 17.5mm, need to find size in Europe
example2.input: Measurement type: diameter, Country: any, Value: 17.5 mm
example2.calculation: Diameter 17.5mm → RU 17 = EU 54 = US 7 = UK K = JP 12 = CN 17
example2.result: Result: RU 17, EU 54, US 7, UK K, JP 12, CN 17
example2.note: Diameter 17.5 mm - standard size for the middle finger

example3.title: Example 3: Conversion US → UK (letters)
example3.description: Ring size US 5, need to find UK size
example3.input: Measurement Type: Ring Size, Country: US, Value: 5
example3.calculation: US 5 → injection diameter 15.7 mm → UK H = RU 15 = EU 50 = JP 8 = CN
example3.result: Result: UK H, RU 15, EU 50, JP 8, CN 15
example3.note: US size 5 corresponds to UK letter H

example4.title: Example 4: JP → EU Conversion
example4.description: Ring size JP 15, need to find size in Europe
example4.input: Measurement Type: Ring Size, Country: JP, Value: 15
example4.calculation: JP 15 → injection diameter 18.9 mm → EU 58 = US 9 = UK N = RU 19 = CN
example4.result: Score: EU 58, US 9, UK N, RU 19, CN 19
example4.note: Japanese size 15 corresponds to European size 58

example5.title: Example 5: Diameter Conversion for an Engagement Ring
example5.description: Diameter measured 16.0 mm, need to find dimensions in all systems
example5.input: Measurement type: diameter, Country: any, Value: 16.0 mm
example5.calculation: Diameter 16.0 mm → RU 15.5 = EU 51 = US 5.5 = UK I = JP 9 = CN 15.5
example5.result: Result: RU 15.5, EU 51, US 5.5, UK I, JP 9, CN 15.5
example5.note: 16.0mm diameter is a popular size for engagement rings

example6.title: Example 6: Converting CN → RU for a wedding ring
example6.description: Chinese ring size 18, need to find size in Russia
example6.input: Measurement Type: Ring Size, Country: CN, Value: 18
example6.calculation: CN 18 → injection diameter 18.2 mm → RU 18 = EU 57 = US 8 = UK M = JP
example6.result: Result: RU 18, EU 57, US 8, UK M, JP 13
example6.note: Chinese size 18 corresponds to Russian size 18

faqItems.q: How to find out ring size online by diameter?
faqItems.a: To determine ring diameter size, measure the inside diameter of the existing ring with a ruler or caliper in millimeters. Then enter the measured diameter into the ring size converter, selecting the "diameter" measurement type. The calculator automatically converts diameter into sizes of all systems (RU, EU, US, UK, JP, CN). For example, a diameter of 16.5 mm corresponds to RU 16, EU 52, US 6, UK J.

faqItems.q: How to convert Russian ring size to American size?
faqItems.a: To convert Russian ring size to American, use the converter: select the measurement type “ring size”, country “RU” and enter your size. The calculator will instantly show the equivalent in the US system and other countries. For example, Russian size 16 = US size 6, size 17 = size 7, size 18 = size 8. Sizes are converted based on the inner diameter of the ring.

faqItems.q: Ring Size Chart: How to Convert EU to US?
faqItems.a: To convert ring size from EU to US, use the converter: select the measurement type “ring size”, country “EU” and enter the size. For example, European size 52 = US size 6, EU 54 = US 7, EU 56 = US 8, EU 58 = US 9. The ring size chart is based on international standards, where each size corresponds to a specific inner diameter of the ring in millimeters.

faqItems.q: How to measure an engagement ring size without an existing ring?
faqItems.a: To measure your engagement ring size without an existing ring: 1) Wrap a strip of paper around your finger where the ring will be; 2) Mark the intersection; 3) Measure the length of the strip in millimeters; 4) Divide by π (3.14) to obtain the diameter; 5) Enter the diameter into the converter. For example, circumference 52 mm = diameter 16.5 mm = US size 6. Measure in the evening when your fingers are slightly swollen.

faqItems.q: Wedding ring sizes: RU, EU, US, UK - what's the difference?
faqItems.a: Wedding ring sizes vary by country: RU (Russia) uses the number system 14-24, EU (Europe) uses 44-64, US (USA) uses 3-8, UK (UK) uses the letter designations F-P. All systems are based on the inner diameter of the ring in millimeters. For example, diameter 16.5 mm = RU 16 = EU 52 = US 6 = UK J. The converter automatically shows all matches.

faqItems.q: How to convert JP (Japan) ring size to Russian size?
faqItems.a: To convert Japanese ring size to Russian, select the measurement type “ring size”, country “JP” and enter the size. Japanese sizes are usually close to European ones: JP 10 = RU 16 = EU 52 = US 6, JP 12 = RU 18 = EU 56 = US 8, JP 15 = RU 19 = EU 58 = US 9. The converter takes into account the peculiarities of the Japanese sizing system and shows exact matches for all countries.

faqItems.q: Inner diameter of the ring: how to measure correctly?
faqItems.a: To correctly measure the inner diameter of a ring: 1) Take a ruler or caliper; 2) Measure the distance between the inner edges of the ring at the widest part; 3) Measure in millimeters for accuracy; 4) Make sure you measure diameter and not circumference. Diameter is the distance in a straight line through the center of the ring. For example, a diameter of 16.5 mm corresponds to size RU 16. A caliper gives a more accurate measurement than a ruler.

faqItems.q: Ring size according to the circumference of the finger: how to calculate?
faqItems.a: To calculate the size of the ring according to the circumference of your finger: 1) Measure the circumference of your finger with a strip of paper or thread; 2) Get the length in millimeters; 3) Divide by π (3.14) to obtain the diameter (diameter = circumference / π); 4) Enter the diameter into the converter. For example, circumference 52 mm ÷ 3.14 = diameter 16.5 mm = US size 6. The circumference can be measured in the evening, when the fingers are slightly swollen, for a more accurate result.

faqItems.q: Is the ring size converter suitable for engagement rings?
faqItems.a: Yes, the ring size converter is fully suitable for wedding rings, as well as engagement rings, signet rings, signet rings and any other type of rings. The converter uses standardized size charts that are suitable for all types of jewelry. It is only important to correctly measure the inner diameter or circumference of the finger. For wedding rings, it is recommended to measure in the evening and take into account the width of the ring (wide rings require a larger size).

faqItems.q: How accurate are the ring size charts in the converter?
faqItems.a: The ring size charts in the converter are based on international ISO standards and are regularly updated to ensure maximum accuracy. Sizes are converted based on exact matches of the inner diameters of the rings in millimeters. However, accuracy may vary by manufacturer as some brands may use their own sizing charts. The converter gives approximate values, which in most cases correspond to standard sizes. For critical purchases, it is recommended that you additionally check the specific manufacturer's sizing charts.

faqItems.q: What ring size corresponds to a diameter of 16 mm?
faqItems.a: Diameter 16 mm corresponds to the following sizes: RU 15.5, EU 50-51, US 5-5.5, UK I, JP 8-9, CN 15.5. This is a medium size, suitable for many women and some men. The 16mm diameter is often used for engagement and wedding rings. The converter automatically shows all matches when entering the diameter. Please note that even a small difference of 0.5mm can change the size, so it is important to measure the diameter accurately.

faqItems.q: UK ring size: how to convert letters?
faqItems.a: UK ring sizes use letter designations from F to P. To convert, select the measurement type "ring size", country "UK" and enter the letter (for example, J, K, L). The converter will automatically show the equivalents: UK J = US 6 = EU 52 = RU 16, UK K = US 7 = EU 54 = RU 17, UK L = US 8 = EU 56 = RU 18. UK letter sizes are easy to remember and are widely used in the jewelry industry.

faqItems.q: How to convert Chinese ring size (CN) to European (EU)?
faqItems.a: To convert Chinese ring size to European, select the measurement type "ring size", country "CN" and enter the size. Chinese sizes are often close to Russian and European: CN 16 = EU 52 = RU 16 = US 6, CN 18 = EU 56 = RU 18 = US 8, CN 20 = EU 60 = RU 20 = US 10. The converter takes into account the features of the Chinese sizing system and shows exact matches for all countries. Chinese sizes may vary by region.

faqItems.q: Can I use a converter to determine my diamond ring size?
faqItems.a: Yes, the ring size converter can be used to determine the size of a diamond ring, engagement ring with stones, or any other piece of jewelry. The converter works with the inner diameter of the ring, which is independent of the presence or type of inserts. It is important to correctly measure the inner diameter of the ring where the finger contacts the metal. Rings with a wide setting may require a 0.5 size larger due to the increased width.

faqItems.q: How to measure ring size using a paper strip?
faqItems.a: To measure ring size with a paper strip: 1) Cut a strip of paper 1 cm wide; 2) Wrap the strip tightly around your finger where the ring will be (not too tight); 3) Mark the intersection with a pencil; 4) Unfold the strip and measure the length in millimeters; 5) Divide by π (3.14) to obtain the diameter; 6) Enter the diameter into the converter. For example, length 52 mm ÷ 3.14 = 16.5 mm diameter = US size 6. Measure in the evening for a more accurate result.

faqItems.q: Engagement ring size: how to determine correctly?
faqItems.a: To determine your engagement ring size: 1) Measure your finger in the evening when it is slightly swollen (more accurate measurement); 2) Use a paper strip or a special ring meter; 3) Measure the circumference or diameter; 4) Use the converter to obtain the size in the desired system; 5) Consider the width of the ring (wide engagement rings require a size 0.5 larger). Popular engagement ring sizes: US 6 (EU 52, RU 16), US 7 (EU 54, RU 17), US 8 (EU 56, RU 18).

faqItems.q: What is the difference between ring sizes for men and women?
faqItems.a: Ring sizes for men are usually larger than for women due to the thicker fingers. Average sizes: women - US 6-7 (EU 52-54, RU 16-17, diameter 16.5-17.3 mm), men - US 9-10 (EU 58-60, RU 19-20, diameter 19.1-19.9 mm). However, sizes are individual and may vary. The size converter works the same for men's and women's rings, as it uses a single diameter system. The size is determined only by the inner diameter of the ring, not by the gender.

faqItems.q: How to convert ring size from US to UK letter size?
faqItems.a: To convert a ring size from US to UK letter, select the measurement type "ring size", country "US" and enter the size. The converter will automatically show the UK letter equivalent: US 5 = UK H, US 6 = UK J, US 7 = UK K, US 8 = UK L, US 9 = UK N, US 10 = UK O. UK sizes use letters from F (smallest) to P (largest). The converter takes into account all correspondences between numeric and alphabetic systems.

faqItems.q: Ring size online: can you trust the results?
faqItems.a: The online ring size converter can be used as a guide, but for critical purchases (especially engagement and wedding rings) it is recommended to: 1) Double check the diameter or circumference measurement; 2) Check the size charts of a specific manufacturer or store; 3) Consult a jeweler for accurate measurements; 4) If possible, try on a ring of a similar size. The converter uses standardized tables that are suitable for most manufacturers, but individual brands may have slight differences.

faqItems.q: Ring diameter in mm: how to convert to size?
faqItems.a: To convert the ring diameter in millimeters to size, use the converter: select the “diameter” measurement type and enter the value in millimeters. The calculator automatically converts diameter to dimensions for all systems. Standard fits: 15.7mm = US 5, 16.5mm = US 6, 17.3mm = US 7, 18.1mm = US 8, 18.9mm = US 9, 19.7mm = US 10. Diameter is measured between the inner edges of the ring. The larger the diameter, the larger the ring size in all systems.

faqItems.q: Ring sizes JP (Japan) and CN (China): how do they differ from European ones?
faqItems.a: Japanese and Chinese ring sizes are based on the same diameter system as European ones, but use their own numbering. Japanese sizes: JP 10 = EU 52 = RU 16, JP 12 = EU 56 = RU 18, JP 15 = EU 58 = RU 19. Chinese sizes: CN 16 = EU 52 = RU 16, CN 18 = EU 56 = RU 18, CN 20 = EU 60 = RU 20. The main difference is in numbering, not diameter. The converter takes these differences into account and shows exact matches. Sizes may vary depending on manufacturer.

faqItems.q: How to measure ring size with calipers?
faqItems.a: To measure ring size with calipers: 1) Take a caliper (vernier or digital); 2) Place the jaws of the caliper inside the ring; 3) Gently spread the jaws until they touch the inner edges of the ring; 4) Record the measurement; 5) Read the value in millimeters; 6) Enter the diameter into the converter. A caliper gives a more accurate measurement than a ruler (accuracy up to 0.1 mm). For example, measured diameter 16.5mm = US size 6. Measure at the widest part of the inner diameter of the ring.

faqItems.q: Engagement ring size: how to choose the right one to buy online?
faqItems.a: To select the correct engagement ring size when purchasing online: 1) Measure the inner diameter of your existing ring or the circumference of your finger; 2) Use the converter to get the size in the store system; 3) Check the size chart on the store’s website; 4) Consider the width of the ring (wide rings require a size 0.5 larger); 5) Measure in the evening, when your fingers are slightly swollen; 6) If in doubt, choose a size 0.5 larger; 7) Check the return and exchange policy. For engagement and wedding rings, additional consultation with a jeweler is recommended.

faqItems.q: Can the converter be used for signets and rings?
faqItems.a: Yes, the ring size converter can be used for signets, rings, wedding rings, engagement rings and any other jewelry that fits on the finger. The converter works with the inner diameter of the ring, which is the same for all types of rings. However, wide signets and rings may require a size 0.5-1 larger due to the increased width and weight of the product. Keep in mind that signets often have a wider frame, so measure the inner diameter where it touches your finger.

faqItems.q: Ring size by finger size: how to determine without a ring?
faqItems.a: To determine your ring size based on your finger without an existing ring: 1) Wrap a strip of paper around your finger where the ring will be (not too tight, but snug); 2) Mark the intersection; 3) Measure the circumference in millimeters; 4) Divide by π (3.14) to obtain the diameter; 5) Enter the diameter into the converter. Alternative: Use a ring gauge (a special tool) or visit a jeweler for a professional measurement. Measure in the evening and at a comfortable temperature for a more accurate result.

faqItems.q: Does the width of the ring affect the size?
faqItems.a: Yes, the width of the ring affects the wearing comfort, so wide rings (more than 6-8 mm) should be 0.5-1 size larger than narrow rings (less than 4 mm). This is because wider rings put more pressure on the finger and can be uncomfortable if the size is too small. For narrow wedding rings (3-4 mm), you can use the standard size. For wide signets and rings (8-12 mm), it is recommended to increase the size by 0.5-1. The converter gives a base size that can be adjusted depending on the width of the ring.

faqItems.q: Ring size for different fingers: is it different?
faqItems.a: Yes, the ring size is different for different fingers due to different finger thicknesses. Usually: the ring finger of the left hand (for a wedding finger) is medium size, the ring finger of the right hand is 0.5-1 size larger, the index finger is 1 size larger, the little finger is 2-3 sizes smaller, the thumb is 3-4 sizes larger. Sizes are individual and may vary. The converter can be used to determine the size of any finger - simply measure the diameter or circumference of the desired finger and enter the value into the calculator.

faqItems.q: How to convert ring size when shopping on AliExpress?
faqItems.a: To purchase rings on AliExpress, use a converter, taking into account that most products from Chinese sellers use Chinese sizes (CN). Select the measurement type "ring size", country "CN" and enter the size. Also consider: 1) Read reviews about the size of a specific product; 2) Measure the diameter or circumference of your finger accurately; 3) Check the size charts in the product description; 4) Choose a size 0.5 larger if in doubt; 5) Please note that Chinese sizes may vary; 6) Check the return policy. Chinese sizes are often close to Russian and European ones.

faqItems.q: Online ring size calculator: does it work for all types of metals?
faqItems.a: Yes, the ring size converter works for all types of metals (gold, silver, platinum, titanium, stainless steel) and alloys. The ring size is determined by the inner diameter, which is the same regardless of the material. However, be aware of the specifics: gold and silver rings may stretch slightly over time, titanium rings are not resizable, platinum rings are heavier and may require a slightly larger size. The converter shows the base size, which can be adjusted depending on the material and width of the ring.

faqItems.q: Ring size matching chart: how to use?
faqItems.a: The ring size correspondence table shows the equivalents between RU, EU, US, UK, JP, CN systems. To use: 1) Determine your size in one system; 2) Find the corresponding line in the table; 3) Read the equivalents on all systems. For example, size RU 16 = EU 52 = US 6 = UK J = JP 10 = CN 16, diameter 16.5 mm. The converter automatically displays the entire correspondence table when entering a size or diameter. The table is based on the inner diameter of the ring in millimeters, which is the same standard for all systems.

faqItems.q: Diamond engagement ring size: how to choose?
faqItems.a: To select the correct diamond engagement ring size: 1) Measure your finger in the evening for a more accurate result; 2) Use the converter to obtain the size in the desired system; 3) Consider the width of the frame - wide frames with large stones require a size 0.5 larger; 4) Check the size on an existing ring of similar width; 5) Keep in mind that engagement rings are often worn together with wedding rings, so the size should be comfortable for both; 6) For expensive purchases, it is recommended to consult a jeweler. Popular sizes: US 6-7 (EU 52-54, RU 16-17).

faqItems.q: Can I change my ring size after purchase?
faqItems.a: Yes, most rings can be resized after purchase, but this depends on the material and width of the ring. Gold and silver rings can be increased or decreased by 1-2 sizes. Platinum rings can also be modified, but it is more difficult. Titanium rings and some alloys cannot be resized. Wide rings are more difficult to modify than narrow ones. To resize, contact your jeweler. Therefore, it is important to determine the correct size before purchasing using a converter and accurately measuring the diameter or circumference of your finger.

faqItems.q: Ring size according to finger length: does finger length affect size?
faqItems.a: The length of the finger does not directly affect the size of the ring, since the size is determined by the girth (circumference) of the finger in the place where the ring will be, and not by the length. However, long fingers may have a smaller girth, while short fingers may have a larger girth. The size of the ring depends on the thickness of the finger (girth), which varies individually. The size converter works with the diameter or circumference of a finger, which is independent of length. To determine your exact size, measure the circumference of your finger with a strip of paper or the diameter of your existing ring.

faqItems.q: How often are the ring size tables in the converter updated?
faqItems.a: The ring size charts in the converter are updated regularly based on current international ISO standards and changes in country sizing systems. Updates occur as new standards emerge and the correspondence between systems becomes clearer. The converter uses verified data from international sizing organizations. However, it should be remembered that individual manufacturers may have their own sizing systems, so the converter provides indicative values ​​that are suitable for most cases.

faqItems.q: Ring finger ring size: what is the standard size?
faqItems.a: Standard ring size for the ring finger of the left hand (wedding) for women: US 6-7 (EU 52-54, RU 16-17, diameter 16.5-17.3 mm). For men: US 9-10 (EU 58-60, RU 19-20, diameter 18.9-19.7 mm). However, sizes are individual and can vary significantly. For the ring finger of the right hand, the size is usually 0.5-1 larger than for the left. To determine the exact size, measure the circumference or diameter of a specific finger and use a converter. Measure in the evening for a more accurate result.

faqItems.q: Does the ring size converter work for all countries?
faqItems.a: Yes, the ring size converter supports all major international sizing systems: RU (Russia), EU (Europe), US (USA), UK (Great Britain), JP (Japan) and CN (China). These systems cover most countries in the world. Some countries may use one of these systems or variations of them. The converter shows correspondence between all supported systems and works in both forward and reverse conversion directions. If your country uses a different system, choose the closest one (for example, EU countries use EU, CIS countries often use RU).

faqItems.q: Ring size online for free: how much does it cost to use a converter?
faqItems.a: The ring size converter is completely free and does not require registration. You can use it an unlimited number of times to convert sizes between any systems. The converter works online, does not require installation of programs and is available 24/7. All features, including size and diameter conversion, correspondence tables and multilingual interface, are provided free of charge. The converter is funded by advertising and is an open tool for all users.
