faqItems.q: How to calculate the electricity consumption of household appliances?
faqItems.a: Enter the power of the device, operating time and quantity - the calculator will show the consumption.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate the cost of energy?
faqItems.a: Yes, it is enough to indicate the tariff for 1 kWh.

faqItems.q: How to convert Watts to kWh?
faqItems.a: 1 kWh = 1000 W times the number of operating hours divided by 1000.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to add multiple devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator supports calculations for a list of devices.

faqItems.q: Can the night rate be taken into account?
faqItems.a: Yes, there are fields for day and night rates.

faqItems.q: Does the calculator take into account a three-phase network?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can specify the network type and voltage.

faqItems.q: How to calculate energy consumption for a year?
faqItems.a: The results are automatically recalculated by month and year.

faqItems.q: Can I use the calculator for an office or workshop?
faqItems.a: Yes, there is a “commercial use” mode.

faqItems.q: How to find out which appliances consume the most?
faqItems.a: The results are displayed in a chart by device.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to export the report?
faqItems.a: Yes, results can be saved in PDF or CSV format.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to take into account the load factor?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator takes into account the effective power (real load).

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption in a private home?
faqItems.a: To calculate electricity consumption in a private home, indicate all electrical appliances used: lighting, heating, household appliances, pumps, wells and others. For example, a house with heating, lighting, household appliances: total consumption can be 500-1500 kWh/month depending on the area and number of appliances. The calculator allows you to add all devices and calculate the total consumption.

faqItems.q: How to calculate energy consumption for a heating system?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for the heating system, indicate the power of the heaters, operating time and the number of devices. For example, a 2000 W electric convector operating 12 hours a day: consumption 2 kW × 12 hours × 30 days = 720 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 3,960 ₽/month. The calculator takes into account all parameters.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the electricity consumption for an air conditioner?
faqItems.a: To calculate the power consumption of an air conditioner, enter the power consumption of the air conditioner (not cooling power), operating time and load factor. For example, a 1500 W air conditioner running 8 hours a day at 70% load factor: effective power 1,050 W, consumption 1.05 kW × 8 hours × 30 days = 252 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 1,386 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate power consumption for a computer?
faqItems.a: To calculate the power consumption for a computer, indicate the power of the power supply or actual consumption, operating time and the number of computers. For example, a 250 W computer running 10 hours a day: consumption 0.25 kW × 10 hours × 30 days = 75 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is 412.5 ₽/month. Gaming computers consume more energy.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the electricity consumption for a refrigerator?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption of a refrigerator, keep in mind that the refrigerator does not operate constantly, but turns on when necessary. Specify the average power of the refrigerator (usually 100-200 W) and take into account operation 24 hours a day with a load factor of 30-50%. For example, a 150 W refrigerator with a load factor of 40%: effective power 60 W, consumption 0.06 kW × 24 hours × 30 days = 43.2 kWh/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption using a meter?
faqItems.a: To calculate your meter's electricity consumption, record the readings at the beginning and end of the period. The difference will show consumption. For example, beginning of the month: 1,500 kWh, end of the month: 1,750 kWh. Consumption: 250 kWh. At a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is: 250 × 5.5 = 1,375 ₽. The calculator helps check whether actual consumption corresponds to calculated values.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for a month?
faqItems.a: To calculate monthly electricity consumption, multiply daily consumption by 30 days or use a calculator indicating the days of operation per month. For example, daily consumption 7 kWh: monthly consumption 7 × 30 = 210 kWh. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost per month is: 210 × 5.5 = 1,155 ₽. The calculator shows consumption both per day and per month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of electricity for construction?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of electricity for construction, indicate all construction tools and equipment: concrete mixers, welding machines, grinders, drills, hammer drills, lighting. For example, a facility with 5 tools with a total power of 8 kW, operating 8 hours per day, 20 days per month: consumption 8 kW × 8 hours × 20 days = 1,280 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 7,040 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate power consumption for LED lamps?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for LED lamps, indicate the lamp power, number of lamps, operating time and number of days. LED lamps consume 6-10 times less energy than incandescent lamps. For example, 10 LED lamps of 9 W (instead of 60 W), operating 6 hours a day: consumption 0.09 kW × 10 pcs × 6 hours × 30 days = 162 kWh/month. Savings compared to incandescent lamps: about 85%.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the energy consumption for a washing machine?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for a washing machine, indicate the power of the machine (usually 2000-2500 W), the operating time of one wash cycle and the number of washes per week/month. For example, washing machine 2000 W, one cycle 2 hours, 2 times a week: consumption 2 kW × 2 hours × 8 times a month = 32 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is 176 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the energy consumption for a dishwasher?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption of a dishwasher, indicate the power of the machine (usually 1500-2000 W), the operating time of one cycle (usually 1.5-2 hours) and the number of cycles. For example, dishwasher 1800 W, one cycle 1.5 hours, 1 time per day: consumption 1.8 kW × 1.5 hours × 30 days = 81 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is 445.5 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for an electric boiler?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for an electric boiler, indicate the boiler power, operating time per day and the duration of the heating season. For example, a 10 kW boiler operating 12 hours a day: daily consumption 10 kW × 12 h = 120 kWh, monthly consumption 120 × 30 = 3,600 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 19,800 ₽/month. Electric heating is expensive.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the electricity consumption for a water heater?
faqItems.a: To calculate the electricity consumption for a water heater, indicate the boiler power and operating time. The water heater cycles to maintain temperature. For example, a 2000 W boiler running 4 hours a day: consumption 2 kW × 4 hours × 30 days = 240 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 1,320 ₽/month. Savings: use the night tariff and adjust the temperature.

faqItems.q: How to calculate energy consumption for an electric floor?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for an electric heated floor, indicate the power per m² (usually 80-150 W/m²), heating area, operating time per day and load factor. For example, underfloor heating 100 W/m² on an area of ​​20 m², operating 8 hours a day with a load factor of 50%: effective power 20 m² × 100 W × 0.5 = 1,000 W, consumption 1 kW × 8 hours × 30 days = 240 kWh/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for an electric stove?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for an electric stove, indicate the power of the burners, operating time and number of uses. For example, a stove with a 2000 W burner operating 2 hours a day: consumption 2 kW × 2 hours × 30 days = 120 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 660 ₽/month. Electric stoves consume a lot of energy when operating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the electricity consumption for a well pump?
faqItems.a: To calculate the electricity consumption for a well pump, indicate the pump power, operating time per day and load factor. For example, a 1000 W pump running 2 hours a day: consumption 1 kW × 2 hours × 30 days = 60 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 330 ₽/month. The pumps operate in cycles to maintain pressure.

faqItems.q: How to calculate energy consumption for ventilation?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption for ventilation, indicate the fan power, operating time and the number of fans. For example, a 150 W fan running 12 hours a day: consumption 0.15 kW × 12 hours × 30 days = 54 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is 297 ₽/month. Ventilation operates around the clock to maintain air quality.

faqItems.q: How to calculate power consumption for chargers?
faqItems.a: To calculate the energy consumption of chargers, indicate the charger power and charging time. Typically, phone chargers have a power rating of 5-15W. For example, a 10W charger running 3 hours per day: consumption 0.01 kW × 3 hours × 30 days = 0.9 kWh/month. Despite the low consumption, it is worth turning off the chargers after charging.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for a home theater?
faqItems.a: To calculate the power consumption for a home theater, indicate the power of all components: TV, receiver, subwoofer, speakers. For example, a system with a total power of 500 W, operating 4 hours per day: consumption 0.5 kW × 4 hours × 30 days = 60 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 330 ₽/month. Cinemas consume a lot of energy during playback mode.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for a summer house?
faqItems.a: To calculate the electricity consumption for a dacha, take into account periodic use (non-permanent residence) and a minimum set of appliances. For example, a cottage with lighting (200 W), a refrigerator (150 W) and a pump (500 W), visited only on weekends: consumption is significantly lower than for permanent residence. When working 8 hours a day, 2 days a week: weekly consumption about 6.8 kWh, monthly consumption about 27 kWh.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for a workshop?
faqItems.a: To calculate electricity consumption for a workshop, indicate all tools and equipment: machines, welding machines, compressors, lighting. For example, a workshop with 3 machines (3000 W each), a compressor (2000 W) and lighting (1000 W): total power 12 kW. When operating 6 hours a day 22 days a month: consumption 12 kW × 6 hours × 22 days = 1.584 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is 8,712 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for a garage?
faqItems.a: To calculate your garage's energy consumption, consider lighting, power tools, and possible heating. For example, a garage with lights (500 W) and power tools (1500 W) running 4 hours per day: consumption 2 kW × 4 hours × 30 days = 240 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 1,320 ₽/month. Power tools consume a lot of energy when operating.

faqItems.q: How to reduce energy consumption?
faqItems.a: To reduce energy consumption: use energy-efficient A+++ class appliances, replace incandescent lamps with LED lamps (85% savings), install thermostats to regulate temperature, use night tariffs for energy-intensive appliances, regularly service equipment, disconnect unused appliances from the network, use smart sockets for automatic control. Comprehensive measures can reduce consumption by 30-50%.

faqItems.q: How to calculate savings from using energy-efficient appliances?
faqItems.a: To calculate savings from using energy-efficient appliances, compare the consumption of old and new appliances. For example, replacing 10 incandescent lamps (60 W) with LED lamps (9 W): savings of 510 W, when working 8 hours a day, savings of 122.4 kWh/month, savings of 673.2 ₽/month. Replacing an old refrigerator (200 W) with a new A+++ (100 W): saving 72 kWh/month, saving 396 ₽/month. Total savings: about 1,069 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for electric heating?
faqItems.a: To calculate energy consumption for electric heating, indicate the power of all heaters, operating time and temperature. Electric heating is very energy intensive. For example, a 100 m² house with heaters with a total capacity of 12 kW running 16 hours a day: consumption 12 kW × 16 hours × 30 days = 5,760 kWh/month. With a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost: 31,680 ₽/month. Electric heating is the most expensive.

faqItems.q: Is the electricity consumption calculator free?
faqItems.a: Yes, the electricity consumption calculator is completely free and does not require registration. You can use it an unlimited number of times to calculate the energy consumption of any type of premises, devices and usage scenarios. The calculator works online, does not require installation of programs and is available 24/7. All functions, including calculations for household appliances, construction tools, office equipment, data export to PDF and CSV, scenario comparison and savings calculations, are provided free of charge. The service is financed by advertising and is an open tool for all users.

seo.description: Online calculator for calculating the consumption and cost of natural gas for heating, cooking or water heating.

overview.title: About the calculator
overview.content: The calculator will help you calculate the consumption and cost of natural gas depending on the purpose, equipment capacity, operating time and tariffs.
overview.additionalContent: The gas consumption calculator uses standard formulas for calculating natural gas consumption. The calculation is based on equipment power, operating time, system efficiency and gas tariff. Formula: Gas consumption (m³/h) = Power (kW) / 10 / efficiency. Daily consumption = Consumption per hour × Operating hours. Cost = Gas consumption × Tariff. The calculator supports three main uses: space heating, hot water supply and cooking. The area of ​​the room is also taken into account when calculating heating.

calculationExamples.title: Examples of calculating gas consumption
calculationExamples.content: Let's look at practical examples of calculating gas consumption and cost for various use scenarios:

example1.title: Example 1: Heating a private house
example1.description: House 100 m², gas boiler 20 kW, heating 16 hours a day
example1.input: Purpose: Heating, Area: 100 m², Power: 20 kW, Hours/day: 16, Efficiency: 90%, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³, Period: 180 days
example1.calculation:
Gas consumption per hour: 20 / 10 / 0.9 = 2.22 m³/h
Daily flow: 2.22 × 16 = 35.52 m³/day
Monthly consumption: 35.52 × 30 = 1,065.6 m³/month
Consumption for the period: 35.52 × 180 = 6,393.6 m³/season
Cost per day: 35.52 × 7 = 248.64 ₽
Cost per season: 6,393.6 × 7 = 44,755.2 RUR
example1.result: Consumption per hour: 2.22 m³/h, Consumption per season: 6,393.6 m³, Cost per season: 44,755.2 ₽
example1.note: Gas heating is the most economical for private homes

example2.title: Example 2: Hot water supply
example2.description: Geyser 24 kW for heating water 8 hours a day
example2.input: Purpose: Hot water, Power: 24 kW, Hours/day: 8, Efficiency: 85%, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³, Period: 30 days
example2.calculation:
Gas consumption per hour: 24 / 10 / 0.85 = 2.82 m³/h
Daily flow: 2.82 × 8 = 22.56 m³/day
Monthly consumption: 22.56 × 30 = 676.8 m³/month
Cost per day: 22.56 × 7 = 157.92 RUR
Cost per month: 676.8 × 7 = 4,737.6 ₽
example2.result: Consumption per hour: 2.82 m³/h, Consumption per month: 676.8 m³, Cost per month: 4,737.6 ₽
example2.note: Geyser is effective for constant hot water supply

example3.title: Example 3: Cooking
example3.description: Gas stove 5 kW for cooking 4 hours a day
example3.input: Purpose: Cooking, Power: 5 kW, Hours/day: 4, Efficiency: 60%, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³, Period: 30 days
example3.calculation:
Gas consumption per hour: 5 / 10 / 0.6 = 0.83 m³/h
Daily flow: 0.83 × 4 = 3.32 m³/day
Monthly consumption: 3.32 × 30 = 99.6 m³/month
Cost per day: 3.32 × 7 = 23.24 RUR
Cost per month: 99.6 × 7 = 697.2 RUR
example3.result: Consumption per hour: 0.83 m³/h, Consumption per month: 99.6 m³, Cost per month: 697.2 ₽
example3.note: A gas stove consumes relatively little gas for cooking

example4.title: Example 4: Heating an apartment with a gas boiler
example4.description: Apartment 60 m², gas boiler 15 kW, heating 12 hours a day
example4.input: Purpose: Heating, Area: 60 m², Power: 15 kW, Hours/day: 12, Efficiency: 92%, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³, Period: 180 days
example4.calculation:
Gas consumption per hour: 15 / 10 / 0.92 = 1.63 m³/h
Daily flow: 1.63 × 12 = 19.56 m³/day
Monthly consumption: 19.56 × 30 = 586.8 m³/month
Consumption per season: 19.56 × 180 = 3,520.8 m³/season
Cost per day: 19.56 × 7 = 136.92 RUR
Cost per season: 3,520.8 × 7 = 24,645.6 RUR
example4.result: Consumption per hour: 1.63 m³/h, Consumption per season: 3,520.8 m³, Cost per season: 24,645.6 ₽
example4.note: Gas heating of an apartment is cheaper than central heating with an individual boiler

example5.title: Example 5: Combined use
example5.description: House with heating boiler and hot water heater
example5.input: Heating: 20 kW, 14 hours/day; Hot water: 24 kW, 6 hours/day; Efficiency: 90%, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³
example5.calculation:
Heating:
Flow per hour: 20 / 10 / 0.9 = 2.22 m³/h
Daily flow: 2.22 × 14 = 31.08 m³/day
Hot water:
Flow per hour: 24 / 10 / 0.9 = 2.67 m³/h
Daily flow: 2.67 × 6 = 16.02 m³/day
Total consumption: 31.08 + 16.02 = 47.1 m³/day
Monthly consumption: 47.1 × 30 = 1,413 m³/month
Cost per month: 1,413 × 7 = 9,891 ₽
example5.result: Total consumption: 47.1 m³/day, Monthly consumption: 1,413 m³, Monthly cost: 9,891 ₽
example5.note: Using gas for heating and hot water is economical

example6.title: Example 6: Savings from improved efficiency
example6.description: Comparison of an old boiler (75% efficiency) and a new one (95% efficiency)
example6.input: Power: 20 kW, Hours/day: 16, Old efficiency: 75%, New efficiency: 95%, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³
example6.calculation:
Old boiler (75% efficiency):
Flow per hour: 20 / 10 / 0.75 = 2.67 m³/h
Daily flow: 2.67 × 16 = 42.72 m³/day
Cost per month: 42.72 × 30 × 7 = 8,971.2 ₽

New boiler (95% efficiency):
Flow per hour: 20 / 10 / 0.95 = 2.11 m³/h
Daily flow: 2.11 × 16 = 33.76 m³/day
Cost per month: 33.76 × 30 × 7 = 7,089.6 ₽

Savings: 8,971.2 - 7,089.6 = 1,881.6 ₽/month
example6.note: High boiler efficiency significantly reduces gas consumption

calculation.title: How is it calculated
calculation.content: Gas consumption is calculated based on equipment power, operating time and system efficiency. The cost is determined based on the gas tariff.

advantages.content: Accurate calculation of consumption, taking into account all factors, comparison of different scenarios, calculation for different periods.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for heating?
faqItems.a: Enter the area of ​​the room, boiler power and efficiency. The calculator will calculate the approximate gas consumption per day, month and season.

faqItems.q: How much gas does a 20 kW boiler consume?
faqItems.a: About 2 m³/h at full load, depending on efficiency and temperature.

faqItems.q: How to reduce gas consumption?
faqItems.a: Maintain your equipment regularly, insulate your home, and install thermostats for optimal temperature control.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for heating a house?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for heating a house, use a calculator, indicating the area of ​​the house, the power of the gas boiler, the efficiency of the system, the operating time per day and the gas tariff. For example, a house of 100 m² with a 20 kW boiler operating 16 hours a day at an efficiency of 90%: consumption is about 2.22 m³/h, daily consumption is 35.52 m³, cost per season (180 days) is about 44,755 ₽. The calculator will automatically calculate all parameters.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a gas stove?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a gas stove, indicate the power of the stove (usually 3-8 kW), operating time per day and efficiency (usually 60-70%). For example, a 5 kW stove when operating 4 hours a day: consumption is about 0.83 m³/h, daily consumption is 3.32 m³, monthly consumption is 99.6 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 697 ₽. The calculator takes into account all factors.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a gas water heater?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a gas water heater, indicate the power of the water heater (usually 15-30 kW), operating time per day and efficiency (usually 80-90%). For example, a 24 kW dispenser when operating 8 hours a day and an efficiency of 85%: consumption is about 2.82 m³/h, daily consumption is 22.56 m³, monthly consumption is 676.8 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 4,738 ₽.

faqItems.q: How much gas does a 20 kW gas boiler consume?
faqItems.a: A 20 kW gas boiler with an efficiency of 90% consumes about 2.22 m³/h at full load. When working 16 hours a day, the daily consumption is about 35.52 m³, the monthly consumption is about 1,066 m³. Cost at a rate of 7 ₽/m³: about 249 ₽/day, about 7,462 ₽/month. Consumption depends on temperature, quality of insulation and operating mode.

faqItems.q: How much gas does a 30 kW gas boiler consume?
faqItems.a: A 30 kW gas boiler with an efficiency of 90% consumes about 3.33 m³/h at full load. When working 16 hours a day, the daily consumption is about 53.28 m³, the monthly consumption is about 1,598 m³. Cost at a rate of 7 ₽/m³: about 373 ₽/day, about 11,186 ₽/month. A 30 kW boiler is suitable for large houses of 150-200 m².

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption using a meter?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption on the meter, record the readings at the beginning and end of the period. The difference will show consumption. For example, beginning of the month: 1,500 m³, end of the month: 1,676.8 m³. Consumption: 176.8 m³. At a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost is: 176.8 × 7 = 1,237.6 ₽. The calculator helps check whether actual consumption corresponds to calculated values.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a month?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption per month, multiply the daily consumption by 30 days or use a calculator with a period of 30 days. For example, daily flow 35.52 m³: monthly flow 35.52 × 30 = 1,065.6 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is: 1,065.6 × 7 = 7,459.2 ₽. The calculator shows consumption both per day and per month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of gas for heating?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of gas for heating, multiply the gas consumption in m³ by the tariff. For example, gas consumption per season is 6,393.6 m³ at a tariff of 7 ₽/m³: cost 6,393.6 × 7 = 44,755.2 ₽ per season. Daily cost: 248.64 ₽, monthly cost: 7,459 ₽. The calculator automatically calculates the cost of gas for all periods.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for heating by area?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for heating by area, use the power rate per m² (usually 80-120 W/m²), determine the required boiler power and calculate the consumption. For example, a house of 100 m², norm 100 W/m²: required power 10 kW. At 90% efficiency, gas consumption: 10 / 10 / 0.9 = 1.11 m³/h. When working 16 hours a day: daily consumption 17.76 m³. The calculator automatically calculates the flow rate by area.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for heating an apartment?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for heating an apartment, indicate the area of ​​the apartment, boiler power and operating mode. For example, an apartment of 60 m² with a 15 kW boiler operating 12 hours a day at an efficiency of 92%: consumption is about 1.63 m³/h, daily consumption is 19.56 m³, monthly consumption is 586.8 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 4,108 ₽. Gas heating of an apartment is cheaper than centralized heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for hot water supply?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for hot water supply, indicate the power of the gas water heater, operating time per day and efficiency. For example, a 24 kW dispenser when operating 8 hours a day and an efficiency of 85%: consumption is about 2.82 m³/h, daily consumption is 22.56 m³, monthly consumption is 676.8 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 4,738 ₽. Consumption depends on the amount of hot water.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for cooking?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for cooking, indicate the power of the gas stove (usually 3-8 kW), cooking time per day and efficiency (usually 60%). For example, a 5 kW stove when operating 4 hours a day: consumption is about 0.83 m³/h, daily consumption is 3.32 m³, monthly consumption is 99.6 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 697 ₽. A gas stove consumes relatively little gas.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a year?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a year, multiply the monthly consumption by 12 months or use a calculator with a period of 365 days. For example, monthly flow 1,065.6 m³: annual flow 1,065.6 × 12 = 12,787.2 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per year is: 12,787.2 × 7 = 89,510.4 ₽. The calculator calculates the consumption for the specified period.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption taking into account efficiency?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption taking into account efficiency, use the formula: Consumption (m³/h) = Power (kW) / 10 / efficiency. The higher the efficiency, the lower the consumption. For example, a 20 kW boiler: with an efficiency of 75%, the consumption is 2.67 m³/h, with an efficiency of 95% the consumption is 2.11 m³/h. Savings amount to 21%. The calculator automatically takes into account efficiency when calculating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a double-circuit boiler?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a double-circuit boiler, take into account the use for heating and hot water. For example, a 24 kW boiler: for heating (14 hours/day) consumption 26.67 m³/day, for hot water (6 hours/day) consumption 16.02 m³/day. Total consumption: 42.69 m³/day, monthly consumption 1,280.7 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 8,965 ₽.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a condensing boiler?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a condensing boiler, take into account the high efficiency (95-98%). For example, a 20 kW condensing boiler with an efficiency of 97%: gas consumption about 2.06 m³/h, daily consumption (16 hours) 32.96 m³, monthly consumption 988.8 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 6,922 ₽. Savings up to 15-20% compared to conventional boilers.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for an old boiler?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for an old boiler, take into account the low efficiency (usually 60-75%). For example, an old 20 kW boiler with an efficiency of 70%: gas consumption is about 2.86 m³/h, daily consumption (16 hours) 45.76 m³, monthly consumption 1,372.8 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 9,610 ₽. Replacing with a new boiler (95% efficiency) gives a savings of 21%.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for an insulated house?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for an insulated house, use a reduced power rate per m² (60-80 W/m² instead of 100-120 W/m²). Insulation reduces the required power and gas consumption by 30-40%. For example, an insulated house of 100 m² requires an 8 kW boiler instead of 12 kW: consumption decreases from 42.72 m³/day to 28.48 m³/day. Savings: 14.24 m³/day × 7 ₽ = 99.68 ₽/day.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a summer residence?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a summer residence, take into account periodic use (non-permanent residence). For example, a dacha of 80 m² with a 12 kW boiler, visiting only on weekends (2 days a week): consumption is significantly lower than with permanent residence. When working 8 hours a day, 2 days a week: weekly consumption 48.96 m³, monthly consumption about 210 m³. Cost per month: 1,470 ₽.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption at different temperatures?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption at different temperatures, please note that at low temperatures the boiler operates longer and consumes more gas. For example, at -20°C the boiler operates 18-20 hours a day instead of 12-14 hours. Consumption increases by 40-50%. At -10°C: consumption increases by 20-30%. Use thermostats to optimize flow.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a bath?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a bath, take into account short-term use and the high required temperature. For example, a 20 m² bathhouse with a 15 kW gas stove, heating for 2 hours 2 times a week: hourly consumption 1.67 m³/h, one-time consumption 3.34 m³, weekly consumption 6.68 m³, monthly consumption about 29 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 203 ₽.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a greenhouse?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a greenhouse, take into account the need to maintain a temperature of +18-22°C all year round and large heat losses through the glazing. For example, a 50 m² greenhouse with a 12 kW boiler operating 16 hours a day: flow rate is about 1.33 m³/h, daily flow rate is 21.28 m³, monthly flow rate is 638.4 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 4,469 ₽.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a garage?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a garage, take into account the minimum required temperature (+5-10°C) and poor thermal insulation. For example, a 30 m² garage with a 5 kW gas heater operating 4 hours a day: consumption is about 0.56 m³/h, daily consumption is 2.24 m³, monthly consumption is 67.2 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 470 ₽. Insulating a garage reduces consumption by 30-40%.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for production?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for production, take into account the high power of the equipment, continuous operation and technological needs. For example, production with a 100 kW boiler operating 24 hours a day at an efficiency of 85%: consumption is about 11.76 m³/h, daily consumption is 282.24 m³, monthly consumption is 8,467.2 m³. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the cost per month is 59,270 ₽.

faqItems.q: How to reduce gas consumption for heating?
faqItems.a: To reduce gas consumption for heating: insulate the house (saving 30-40%), replace the old boiler with a new one with high efficiency (saving 20-25%), install thermostats to regulate the temperature (saving 10-15%), regularly maintain equipment, use programmable thermostats to reduce the temperature at night and in the absence of people. Comprehensive measures can reduce consumption by up to 50%.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas savings from insulation?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas savings from insulation, compare the consumption before and after insulation. Insulation reduces the required power by 30-50%. For example, a house of 100 m²: before insulation, a 12 kW boiler is required, consumption 42.72 m³/day; after insulation, an 8 kW boiler is required, consumption 28.48 m³/day. Savings: 14.24 m³/day or 427.2 m³/month. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, savings: 2,990 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for an apartment with central heating and an individual boiler?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for an apartment with central heating and an individual boiler, take into account the use of an individual boiler only for additional heating or a complete replacement of central heating. For example, an apartment of 60 m² with an individual 15 kW boiler for full heating: consumption is about 19.56 m³/day, monthly consumption is 586.8 m³, cost is 4,108 ₽/month. This is 30-40% cheaper than central heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption with a programmable thermostat?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption with a programmable thermostat, take into account the reduction in operating time due to automatic temperature reduction in the absence of people. Programmable thermostats can reduce costs by 15-25%. For example, conventional heating: operation 16 hours a day, consumption 35.52 m³/day. With thermostat: operation 12 hours a day (25% reduction), flow rate 26.64 m³/day. Savings: 8.88 m³/day or 266.4 m³/month, 1,865 ₽/month.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for an apartment building?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for an apartment building, multiply the consumption per apartment by the number of apartments. For example, an apartment of 60 m², consumption 19.56 m³/day. House with 100 apartments: total consumption 1,956 m³/day or 58,680 m³/month. With a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, the total cost: 410,760 ₽/month. The calculator helps you calculate the consumption for individual apartments; summarize the results for the entire house.

faqItems.q: How to calculate gas consumption for a commercial premises?
faqItems.a: To calculate gas consumption for a commercial premises, take into account the operating mode (working days, weekends), area and power of the equipment. For example, an office of 200 m² with a 25 kW boiler operating only on weekdays (5 days a week, 10 hours a day): consumption is significantly lower than with 24-hour heating. Consumption is about 2.78 m³/h, daily consumption is 27.8 m³, monthly consumption (20 working days) is 556 m³. Cost per month: 3,892 ₽.

faqItems.q: Is the gas consumption calculator free?
faqItems.a: Yes, the gas consumption calculator is completely free and does not require registration. You can use it an unlimited number of times to calculate the gas consumption of any type of premises, gas equipment and usage scenarios. The calculator works online, does not require installation of programs and is available 24/7. All functions, including calculations for heating, hot water, cooking, comparison of scenarios and calculation of savings, are provided free of charge. The service is financed by advertising and is an open tool for all users.

seo.description: Online calculator for calculating the cost of heating by type of system, area and tariffs.

overview.title: About the calculator
overview.content: The calculator will help you calculate the cost of heating depending on the type of system, area of ​​the room, length of the season and energy tariffs.
overview.additionalContent: The heating cost calculator uses standard formulas to calculate power, energy consumption and heating costs. The calculation is based on the area of ​​the room, the required temperature, the type of heating system, efficiency and energy tariffs. Formula: Power (W) = Area (m²) × Power per m² × Temperature coefficient. Consumption (kWh) = (Power × Operating hours × Season days) / (1000 × efficiency). Cost = Consumption × Tariff. The calculator supports all main types of heating: electric, gas, solid fuel and centralized.

calculationExamples.title: Examples of heating cost calculations
calculationExamples.content: Let's look at practical examples of calculating the cost of heating for various types of systems and premises:

example1.title: Example 1: Electric heating of an apartment
example1.description: Apartment 50 m², electric heating, temperature 22°C, season 180 days
example1.input: Area: 50 m², Type: Electric, Temperature: 22°C, Season: 180 days, Hours/day: 12, Tariff: 5.5 ₽/kWh, Efficiency: 100%
example1.calculation:
Power per m²: 80 × (22/20) = 88 W/m²
Required power: 50 × 88 = 4,400 W
Daily consumption: (4,400 × 12) / 1000 = 52.8 kWh
Consumption per season: 52.8 × 180 = 9,504 kWh
Cost per day: 52.8 × 5.5 = 290.4 ₽
Cost per season: 9,504 × 5.5 = 52,272 ₽
example1.result: Power: 4,400 W, Consumption per season: 9,504 kWh, Cost per season: 52,272 ₽
example1.note: Electric heating is convenient, but more expensive than gas

example2.title: Example 2: Gas heating of a private house
example2.description: House 100 m², gas heating, temperature 20°C, season 200 days
example2.input: Area: 100 m², Type: Gas, Temperature: 20°C, Season: 200 days, Hours/day: 16, Tariff: 7 ₽/m³, Efficiency: 90%
example2.calculation:
Power per m²: 80 × (20/20) = 80 W/m²
Required power: 100 × 80 = 8,000 W
Taking into account efficiency (90%): 8,000 / 0.9 = 8,889 W
Daily consumption: (8,889 × 16) / 1000 = 142.2 kWh
Consumption per season: 142.2 × 200 = 28,440 kWh
Conversion to m³ of gas: 28.440 / 10 = 2.844 m³
Cost per season: 2,844 × 7 = 19,908 ₽
example2.result: Power: 8,889 W, Gas consumption: 2,844 m³, Cost per season: 19,908 ₽
example2.note: Gas heating is the most economical for private homes

example3.title: Example 3: Solid fuel heating
example3.description: House 80 m², solid fuel heating, temperature 21°C, season 210 days
example3.input: Area: 80 m², Type: Solid fuel, Temperature: 21°C, Season: 210 days, Hours/day: 14, Tariff: 15 ₽/kg, Efficiency: 75%
example3.calculation:
Power per m²: 80 × (21/20) = 84 W/m²
Required power: 80 × 84 = 6.720 W
Taking into account efficiency (75%): 6.720 / 0.75 = 8.960 W
Daily consumption: (8,960 × 14) / 1000 = 125.4 kWh
Consumption per season: 125.4 × 210 = 26,334 kWh
Conversion to kg fuel: 26.334 / 4 = 6.583.5 kg
Cost per season: 6,583.5 × 15 = 98,752.5 RUR
example3.result: Power: 8,960 W, Fuel consumption: 6,583.5 kg, Cost per season: 98,752.5 RUR
example3.note: Solid fuel heating requires manual fuel loading

example4.title: Example 4: Central heating of an apartment
example4.description: Apartment 60 m², central heating, temperature 23°C, season 180 days
example4.input: Area: 60 m², Type: Centralized, Temperature: 23°C, Season: 180 days, Hours/day: 24, Tariff: 1,800 ₽/Gcal, Efficiency: 85%
example4.calculation:
Power per m²: 80 × (23/20) = 92 W/m²
Required power: 60 × 92 = 5.520 W
Taking into account efficiency (85%): 5.520 / 0.85 = 6.494 W
Daily consumption: (6,494 × 24) / 1000 = 155.9 kWh
Consumption per season: 155.9 × 180 = 28,062 kWh
Conversion to Gcal: 28.062 / 1.163 = 24.13 Gcal
Cost per season: 24.13 × 1,800 = 43,434 RUR
example4.result: Power: 6,494 W, Consumption: 24.13 Gcal, Cost per season: 43,434 ₽
example4.note: Central heating does not require equipment maintenance

example5.title: Example 5: Insulated house with savings
example5.description: Insulated house 120 m², electric heating, power reduction by 40%
example5.input: Area: 120 m², Type: Electric, Temperature: 22°C, Season: 180 days, Hours/day: 10, Tariff: 5.5 ₽/kWh, Efficiency: 100%, Insulation: -40% power
example5.calculation:
Power per m² without insulation: 80 × (22/20) = 88 W/m²
Power per m² with insulation: 88 × 0.6 = 52.8 W/m²
Required power: 120 × 52.8 = 6.336 W
Daily consumption: (6,336 × 10) / 1000 = 63.36 kWh
Consumption per season: 63.36 × 180 = 11,404.8 kWh
Cost per season: 11,404.8 × 5.5 = 62,726.4 RUR
Savings from insulation: 40% of costs
example5.result: Power: 6,336 W, Consumption per season: 11,404.8 kWh, Cost per season: 62,726.4 ₽
example5.note: Insulating your home reduces heating costs by up to 40%

example6.title: Example 6: Comparison of heating types
example6.description: Comparison of heating costs for a 90 m² house by different types
example6.input: Area: 90 m², Temperature: 21°C, Season: 190 days, Hours/day: 14
example6.calculation:
Base power: 90 × 84 = 7,560 W

Electric (5.5 ₽/kWh, efficiency 100%):
Consumption: (7,560 × 14 × 190) / 1000 = 20,109.6 kWh
Cost: 20,109.6 × 5.5 = 110,602.8 ₽

Gas (7 ₽/m³, efficiency 90%):
Consumption: (7,560 × 14 × 190) / (1000 × 0.9) = 22,344 kWh
Gas: 22,344 / 10 = 2,234.4 m³
Cost: 2,234.4 × 7 = 15,640.8 ₽

Conclusion: Gas heating is 7 times cheaper than electric heating
example6.note: Gas heating is 7 times more economical than electric heating

calculation.title: How is it calculated
calculation.content: Power is calculated based on area and temperature. Consumption depends on power, operating time and system efficiency. The cost is calculated according to the energy tariff.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating a house?
faqItems.a: Enter the area, type of heating and tariff - the calculator will calculate the power, consumption and cost of heating for the season.

faqItems.q: What is more profitable - electric or gas heating?
faqItems.a: Gas heating is usually cheaper, but requires the installation of a boiler. Electric is simpler and does not require a chimney.

faqItems.q: How to reduce heating costs?
faqItems.a: Use insulation, smart thermostats and energy-efficient heating appliances.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating an apartment?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating an apartment, use the calculator, indicating the area of ​​the apartment, type of heating (centralized or individual), average temperature, duration of the heating season and energy tariff. For example, an apartment of 60 m² with central heating at a tariff of 1,800 ₽/Gcal: consumption is about 24 Gcal per season, cost is about 43,000 ₽. The calculator will automatically calculate all parameters.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating a private house?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating a private house, indicate the area of ​​the house, the type of heating (gas, electric, solid fuel), the required temperature, the length of the season and tariffs. For example, a 100 m² house with gas heating: consumption of about 2,800 m³ of gas per season at a tariff of 7 ₽/m³, cost about 20,000 ₽. The calculator takes into account the system efficiency and all factors.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the heating power for a room?
faqItems.a: To calculate heating power, use the formula: Power (W) = Area (m²) × Power per m² × Temperature coefficient. Standard power per m²: insulated house - 60-80 W/m², average thermal insulation - 90-120 W/m², old house without insulation - 130-180 W/m², apartment - 70-100 W/m². The calculator automatically calculates the required power based on building type and temperature.

faqItems.q: How to calculate electricity consumption for heating?
faqItems.a: To calculate energy consumption for heating, use the formula: Consumption (kWh) = (Power (W) × Operating hours × Season days) / (1000 × efficiency). For example, power 5,000 W, operation 12 hours a day, season 180 days, efficiency 100%: (5,000 × 12 × 180) / 1000 = 10,800 kWh per season. The calculator automatically calculates daily and seasonal consumption.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of gas heating?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of gas heating, determine gas consumption in m³ and multiply by the tariff. Power is calculated by area and temperature, then converted into gas consumption (1 m³ of gas ≈ 10 kW⋅h). For example, a house of 100 m², power 8,000 W, work 16 hours a day, season 200 days: consumption 28,440 kWh = 2,844 m³ of gas. At a tariff of 7 ₽/m³ the cost: 19,908 ₽ per season.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating using a meter?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating on the meter, record the readings at the beginning and end of the period. The difference will show consumption. For example, beginning of the season: 150 Gcal, end of the season: 174 Gcal. Consumption: 24 Gcal. At a tariff of 1,800 ₽/Gcal, the cost is: 24 × 1,800 = 43,200 ₽. The calculator helps check whether actual consumption corresponds to calculated values.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a month?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating per month, divide the seasonal cost by the number of months in the season or multiply the daily cost by 30 days. For example, the daily cost is 290 ₽: the monthly cost is 290 × 30 = 8,700 ₽. Seasonal cost 52,272 ₽ for 6 months: monthly cost 52,272 / 6 = 8,712 ₽. The calculator shows the cost both per day and for the entire season.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with electricity?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with electricity, multiply the electricity consumption in kWh by the tariff. For example, an apartment of 50 m², power 4,400 W, operation 12 hours a day: daily consumption 52.8 kWh, seasonal consumption (180 days) 9,504 kWh. At a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost per season: 9,504 × 5.5 = 52,272 ₽. The calculator automatically calculates the cost for electric heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with a solid fuel boiler?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with a solid fuel boiler, determine the fuel consumption in kg and multiply by the tariff. Power is calculated by area, then converted into fuel consumption (1 kg of wood ≈ 4 kWh). For example, a house 80 m², power 8,960 W, work 14 hours a day, season 210 days: consumption 26,334 kWh = 6,583.5 kg of fuel. At a rate of 15 ₽/kg, the cost: 98,752.5 ₽ per season.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating by area?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating by area, use the power rate per m² (60-180 W/m² depending on insulation), multiply by the area to get the total power, then calculate consumption and cost. For example, area 100 m², norm 80 W/m²: power 8,000 W. When working 16 hours a day and a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh: daily consumption 128 kWh, cost 704 ₽/day. The calculator automatically calculates the cost by area.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a year?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating per year, multiply the seasonal cost by the number of seasons in a year or use the annual length of the heating season. For example, the seasonal cost is 52,272 RUR for 180 days: the annual cost for one season per year is 52,272 RUR. If the season lasts all year (365 days): the cost will increase proportionally. The calculator calculates the cost for the specified period.

faqItems.q: How to calculate heating costs for a new home?
faqItems.a: To calculate heating costs for a new home, consider the type of insulation and energy efficiency. A modern insulated house requires 60-80 W/m², which is significantly less than an old house (130-180 W/m²). For example, a new house of 120 m² with insulation, power 7,200 W, operation 10 hours a day: consumption of about 8,000 kWh per season. At a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh the cost: 44,000 ₽. The calculator takes into account the type of building when calculating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating according to the standard?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating according to the standard, multiply the area by the standard for thermal energy consumption (Gcal/m²) and by the tariff. For example, an apartment of 60 m², standard 0.04 Gcal/m² per month: consumption 60 × 0.04 × 6 months = 14.4 Gcal per season. At a tariff of 1,800 ₽/Gcal, the cost is 25,920 ₽. The calculator helps to compare standard and actual values.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a summer house?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a summer residence, take into account periodic use (non-permanent residence) and the type of heating. For example, a dacha of 80 m², visits only on weekends (2 days a week), electric heating: consumption is significantly lower than for permanent residence. When working 8 hours a day, 2 days a week per season: consumption is about 2,000 kWh, cost is about 11,000 ₽. The calculator allows you to specify the number of hours of work per day.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with coal?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with coal, determine the coal consumption in kg and multiply by the tariff. Coal has a calorific value of about 7 kWh/kg. For example, a house of 100 m², power 10,000 W, work 16 hours a day, season 200 days: consumption 32,000 kWh = 4,571 kg of coal. At a rate of 20 ₽/kg, the cost: 91,420 ₽ per season. The calculator supports calculations for solid fuel heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with wood?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with wood, determine the wood consumption in m³ or kg and multiply by the tariff. Firewood has a calorific value of about 4 kWh/kg (or 1,200 kWh/m³). For example, a house 80 m², power 8,960 W, work 14 hours a day, season 210 days: consumption 26,334 kWh = 6,583.5 kg of firewood (≈ 6.6 m³). At a tariff of 3,000 ₽/m³ cost: 19,800 ₽ per season.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with pellets?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with pellets, determine the consumption of pellets in kg and multiply by the tariff. Pellets have a calorific value of about 5 kWh/kg. For example, a house of 90 m², power 9,000 W, work 15 hours a day, season 190 days: consumption 25,650 kWh = 5,130 kg of pellets. At a rate of 12 ₽/kg, the cost is 61,560 ₽ per season. The calculator calculates the cost for all types of solid fuel heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with a convector?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with a convector, determine the power of the convector (W), operating time and electricity tariff. For example, convector 2,000 W, operation 10 hours a day, season 180 days: consumption (2,000 × 10 × 180) / 1000 = 3,600 kWh per season. At a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh the cost: 19,800 ₽. For several convectors, add up the power. The calculator automatically calculates the cost for electric convectors.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with infrared heaters?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with infrared heaters, take into account their high efficiency and the possibility of local heating. Infrared heaters require less operating time to achieve a comfortable temperature. For example, 1,500 W heater, operation 6 hours a day (instead of 12 for a convector), 180 days season: consumption (1,500 × 6 × 180) / 1000 = 1,620 kWh per season. At a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh, the cost is 8,910 ₽. Savings up to 50% compared to convectors.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with a heat pump?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with a heat pump, take into account its high coefficient of efficiency (COP) of 3-5. A heat pump consumes electricity but produces 3-5 times more heat. For example, house 100 m², power 8,000 W, COP 4: electricity consumption 8,000 / 4 = 2,000 W. When operating 12 hours a day, 200 days season: consumption (2,000 × 12 × 200) / 1000 = 4,800 kWh. At a tariff of 5.5 ₽/kWh the cost: 26,400 ₽. Savings up to 75% compared to direct electric heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with central heating?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with central heating, use the tariff in Gcal. For example, an apartment of 60 m², consumption of 24 Gcal per season at a tariff of 1,800 ₽/Gcal: cost 24 × 1,800 = 43,200 ₽ per season. Central heating operates around the clock during the heating season and does not require equipment maintenance. The calculator automatically calculates the cost of centralized heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating taking into account insulation?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating taking into account insulation, use the reduced power rate per m². Insulation reduces the required power by 30-50%. For example, a 100 m² house without insulation requires 130 W/m² = 13,000 W. With insulation, the power is reduced to 80 W/m² = 8,000 W. Consumption is reduced by 38%, and the cost is correspondingly reduced. The calculator allows you to take into account the effect of insulation on the cost of heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with a programmable thermostat?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with a programmable thermostat, take into account the reduction in operating time due to the automatic reduction of temperature in the absence of people. Programmable thermostats can reduce costs by 15-25%. For example, conventional heating: work 12 hours a day, cost 52,272 ₽ per season. With thermostat: work 9 hours a day (25% reduction), cost 39,204 ₽. Saving RUB 13,068 per season. The calculator helps you estimate the savings from using a thermostat.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for an apartment building?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for an apartment building, multiply the cost per apartment by the number of apartments. For example, an apartment of 60 m², cost 43,200 ₽ per season. House with 100 apartments: total cost 100 × 43,200 = 4,320,000 RUR per season. The calculator helps you calculate the cost for individual apartments; summarize the results for the entire house.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating using a two-tariff meter?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating using a two-tariff meter, divide consumption into daytime and nighttime, multiply by the corresponding tariffs. For example, consumption of 10,800 kWh per season: daytime 6,480 kWh (tariff 6 ₽/kWh), nighttime 4,320 kWh (tariff 2.5 ₽/kWh). Cost: 6,480 × 6 + 4,320 × 2.5 = 38,880 + 10,800 = 49,680 ₽. With a single tariff meter (5.5 ₽/kWh): 59,400 ₽. Savings of about 16%. The calculator allows you to specify a single-tariff or two-tariff mode.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a commercial premises?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a commercial premises, take into account the operating mode (working days, weekends), area and type of heating. For example, an office of 200 m², work only on weekdays (5 days a week, 8 hours a day), electric heating: consumption is significantly lower than with round-the-clock heating. With a power of 16,000 W, operation 8 hours a day, 5 days a week per season: consumption is about 5,000 kWh, cost is about 27,500 ₽. The calculator allows you to specify the number of hours of work per day.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a production workshop?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a production workshop, take into account the large area, ceiling height and possible technological heat release. Industrial premises require more power per m² due to high ceilings and large volumes. For example, a workshop of 500 m² with a ceiling height of 6 m (volume 3,000 m³): power approximately 150 W/m² = 75,000 W. When working 16 hours a day, season 180 days: consumption about 216,000 kWh, cost about 1,188,000 ₽. The calculator helps calculate the cost for industrial premises.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a warehouse?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a warehouse, take into account the minimum required temperature (usually +5-10°C for storage) and large volumes of premises. Warehouses require less power per m² due to low temperatures. For example, a warehouse of 1,000 m², temperature +8°C, power 40 W/m² = 40,000 W. When working 12 hours a day, season 180 days: consumption about 86,400 kWh, cost about 475,200 ₽. The calculator allows you to specify the required temperature to calculate power.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a greenhouse?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a greenhouse, take into account the need to maintain a high temperature (usually +18-22°C) and large heat losses through the glazing. Greenhouses require more power per m². For example, a greenhouse 100 m², temperature +20°C, power 120 W/m² = 12,000 W. When working 16 hours a day, 365 days season (all year round): consumption is about 70,080 kWh, cost is about 385,440 ₽ per year. Using solar energy and insulation reduces costs.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a garage?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating a garage, take into account the minimum required temperature (usually +5-10°C for comfortable operation) and poor thermal insulation. Garages require more power per m². For example, a garage of 30 m², temperature +10°C, power 100 W/m² = 3,000 W. When working 4 hours a day, season 180 days: consumption about 2,160 kWh, cost about 11,880 ₽. Insulating your garage significantly reduces costs.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a bath?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a bath, take into account short-term use and the high required temperature (usually +80-100°C in a steam room). The sauna requires a lot of power to heat up quickly. For example, a bathhouse of 20 m², temperature +90°C in the steam room, power 200 W/m² = 4,000 W. When working 3 hours a day, 2 times a week, season 180 days: consumption about 1,296 kWh, cost about 7,128 ₽. Using a wood stove can be more economical for a sauna.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating for a heated floor system?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating for a heated floor system, take into account its high efficiency due to uniform heating and the possibility of reducing the air temperature by 2-3°C with the same comfort. Warm floors require a power of 80-120 W/m², depending on the insulation. For example, a house of 100 m² with heated floors, power 100 W/m² = 10,000 W. When working 12 hours a day, season 200 days: consumption about 24,000 kWh, cost about 132,000 ₽. Saving 10-15% compared to radiator heating.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the cost of heating with solar panels?
faqItems.a: To calculate the cost of heating with solar panels, keep in mind that solar energy is free, but requires investment in equipment. Solar panels provide 30-50% of heating needs depending on the region and time of year. For example, a house of 100 m², a demand of 28,440 kWh per season: solar panels can provide 8,500-14,200 kWh, the remaining consumption is covered by the grid. Save 30-50% on heating costs. The payback period of the system is 5-10 years.

faqItems.q: Is the heating cost calculator free?
faqItems.a: Yes, the heating cost calculator is completely free and does not require registration. You can use it an unlimited number of times to calculate the cost of heating any type of premises and heating systems. The calculator works online, does not require installation of programs and is available 24/7. All functions, including calculations for different heating types, system comparisons and savings calculations, are provided free of charge. The service is financed by advertising and is an open tool for all users.
